text: Dark copper colour with an average-sized firm white head. Some lacing. Surprisingly weak aroma shows dough, sugar and a vague hint of tart fruitiness. Luckily more bright in the taste with a very sweet caramel and sugary base, a mild, delicate touch of refreshing sourness bringing balance and hints of cherry fruitiness. Not too rich but pleasantly refreshing. Light bodied with average, soft carbonation, easy and highly drinkable. Overall a light-feeling, quite refreshing, mostly sweet and slightly sour beer. Ok, but not very interesting.

Warka z datą przydatności na butelce 13.11.2017. Piwo w barwie bursztynowe, piana na samym początku się pojawia, ale szybko redukuje się do opaski i nie zostawia koronki na szkle. W aromacie nuty winne i gdzieś w tle końska derka. W smaku natomiast dominują akcenty winne i owocowe (głównie jabłka, ale nie takie kwaśne, jak w Gueze, a także winogrona). W posmaku jest słodko-kwaśno, przez co piwo nie męczy i jest fajnie orzeźwiające.
bottle reddish brown pour with minimal head aroma was sour fruit, vinegar and caramel taste is very sweet and moderately sour
Greetings from Bydgoszcz, Poland to all Beer Geeks and Hopheads around the world!
Caramel, sugar, sour and light acetic notes, deep amber with a thin ocher head, light body, medium carbonation, quite sweet in order to balance sour notes...its ok but not special.

Bottle. Copper brown with a minimal white head. 

Taste has cherry, raisin, brown sugar. Sour aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Zapewne jest to bardzo ciekawa rzecz dla miłośników słodkiego wina. Brzoskwiniowo-jabłkowe aromaty, słodycz w smaku, skontrowana tylko częściowo kwaśnością. Troszkę męczy, ale naprawdę ciekawe i fajne.

Bouteille: Almost clear, chestnut-amber coloured, mid-sized stable and creamy off-white head; distinctive sweet-sourish nose with fruity, cellary and mouldy aromas; moderate sourish-sweet flavour, medium bodied and astonishingly soft; lingering sweet and sourish-tart finish with returning cellary, mouldy and malty flavours. A bit on the sweet side - as expected - but all in all a nice summer-drink...

Das ist ja mal ein Fläschchen, doppelt verkorkt. Optisch bräunlich, keine Perlen, kein Schaum. In der Nase Trauben, Kombucha. Im Trunk sehr sauer, staubig, aber mit interessanter Holznote. Süß aber nicht pappig. Sehr speziell. Bin kein Fan von sauren Bieren, aber das macht Lust.

Proefglas op 37,5cl-fles op Koken met bier bij de Waregemse BierFanaten. U: Helder donkergoudblond met een dunne witte schuimkraag. G: Groene appels, metallisch, hooi en iets muf. S: Zoet met een zeer licht zuurtje. Zeer veel kandij. Karamel en groene appels. M: Weinig body en medium carbonatie.

bjcp:
aromat 6 - zapach dzikusów, trochę owoców jak winie, ale funky dominuje, lekko kocie szyczyny, brak kunia. szczyn. Nie za intensywny, ale wyraźny,
wygląd 1 - mała piana znika błyskawicznie,
smak 12 - cukrowo owocowa szłodycz skontrowana kwaśnością dzukusa. Raczej bez ekstremy,
usta 4 - ech te wysycenie...
ogólnie 5 - za 7 złotych butla całkiem fajny deal
Bottle from Liquor Barn. Complex aroma, but it was overwhelmed by the sugar.

A brownish orange that pours with a thick but diminishing foam. Aroma is a mix of Brett, citrus, and rotten fruit. Taste is another matter. Sweet, lightly tart, and bright citrus and sugar flavors. Enjoyable to drink.
Orange colour some lacing. Barnyard aromas. Dry sugary taste, minimal carbonation.

33cl bottle split with Gyhallmanti. Appearance: amber with low off white head. Aroma: funky, candied sugar, trace of citrus. Taste: high sugary sweetness, low bitterness and pleasant tartness. Notes of candied sugar, white grapes and some apple. Palate: medium bodied, sticky texture and medium carbonation.

25cl bottle split. Courtesy of SimonBlok. Pours a slight hazy orange amber colour with a small off white head which quickly vanishes. Aroma of bitter lemon, lambic, funky, honey. Taste is fairly sweet, light bitter, medium sour with a light bitter finish. Notes of bitter lemon, candy sugar, honey, apple. Texture is oily, medium to light bodied with moderatecarbonation

Bouteille avec un BB du 20/09/2018. Robe ambrée foncée légèrement trouble avec un mince col de mousse blanc et rocailleux. Arômes de pommes caramélisé, minéraux, lambics à faible acidité, sucre candi/gomme balloune, miel brun. En bouche, entrée agréable de compote de pommes et au sucre brun, citron, bois mouillé, abricot. Arrivent ensuite des saveurs moins balancées de lambics, raisins rouges, miel et de sucre qui semble artificiel. Ces derniers créent une finale qui rend le liquide lourd et lassant après quelques gorgées. Dommage car la première vague de saveurs est bien. Texture huileuse et épaisse, corps moyen qui tend vers le haut.
Amber with sweet nose and some honey accents. Taste is honey and sweet sourness with fruity finish. Likeable.
Pleasantly surprised by this.  Sweetness in aroma not too dominating. Taste is funky and sour but complexity lost in sweetish aftertaste. Mouthfeel soft but sticky.
Kolor jasno bursztynowy, klarowne.Aromaty winne, czuć delikatną kwasowość. W smaku słodko-kwaśne. Aromatów dzikich brak.
Bottle. Brown/tea colour, small off-white head. Aroma mainly apples/cider/calvados. Fizzy. Sweet apple taste. Not at all my cup of tea.

Reddish amber appearance with a small white head and little lacing. Tart apples mix with other fruit in the aroma. Earthy, funky, sour flavors smash up against the inherent sweetness of the style. The sweetness does not become too cloying until the aftertaste, where it lingers longer than desirable. Interesting change of pace from my steady diet of IPAs. Thanks to Sloth for the trade.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2017 pours almost clear dark golden orange with a very small fizzy off-white cap offering little to no retention, or lacing. sweet apricots, pale figs, some caramelized fruitiness, apples for instance, wood barrels - softly bitter tannins; light acidity - some underlying funk; sugar - woodsy candi and powdery stevia; cardboard traces, grass and herbs. moderately low yet prickly carbonation, light body, semi-sweet tart spicy finish. nice faro, not too sweet and preserving a wild character. quite enjoyed this one!
Alcohol, citrus and fruits. Amber and clear, heavy cloying sweetness with medium sourness. Fizzy carbonation. Very good lambic beer.

Bottle with expiry date 22 Nov 2018. Copper colour, clear, no head. Faint aroma, a bit of sauerkraut, brown sugar, green apple. Medium sweet, lightly sour. Medium carbonation. Too sweet, not very interesting.

Aromas acidos, caramelo y a levadura.
Buen aspecto caronatación correcta, con poca espuma.
En busca dulce y refrescante

UPDATED: APR 8, 2017 Pours a very clear copper with a thin white head that manages to leave pretty nice lacing. Nose is of some nice lambic funk with minimal difference from a straight lambic. Taste is much sweeter than straight lambic, though, almost too much if you ask me but not quite. Ive sampled sweeter ones in the past so I guess this one gets a "Pass" rating. There is still some nice lambic behind all that sweetness, though. Browned apples impressions. Body is medium, carbonation moderate. Pretty good but Id be hard pressed to say when I would like to drink this in place of a nice gueuze.
Belle faro lambic, moins sucrée que ses consoeurs et moins douce que le cidre

Aroma: fruits, sweet.
Appearance: light brown without head.
Taste: fruits, sweet, a bit sour, dry wine finish.
Palate: light body, light carbonation.

Bottiglia da 37,5 cl. Color ambrato con schiuma bianca fine non di grande tenuta. Al naso note dolciastre fruttate. Al palato inizia con un leggero frizzantino seguito da note dolci mielose e fruttate che solo sul finale lasciano spazio alle note acidule del lambic.

Butelka 750ml. pita w domu. Kolor złoty przechodzący w bursztynowy,klarowne, mocno nagazowane, piana średnia osiada na szkle.Aromat to owoce winne, lekka kwasowość w smaku kwaśne takie jak przy spożywaniu cytryny, no trochę mniejsza i przyjemniejsza łagodzona przez słodycz.. Taki dzikus ale mnie smakuje, bardzo dobre.
Bottle shared. Dark copper pour. Aroma is sugary, some malts and hop. Taste is great, perfect amount of sugar for me, sweet but not too sweet. Interesting style, like it.
alcohol, citrus, golden, sparkling, heavy cloying sweetness, medium sourness, light body, thin feel, fizzy, bitter,
Bottle. Amber in colour. Fruity (cherries) and spicy. Very well balanced; less sweet than I expected. Nice sour edge to it. Quite dry in the finish. (2008)

Barwa to bursztyn przechodzący w czerwień, piwo klarowne. Piana jasnopomarańczowa, raczej skromna, szybko opada i zostaje tylko pierścień przy brzegach. W aromacie wyraźna dzikość, stajnia, końska derka, jest wyraźna nuta winna, owocowa kwaśność, przefermentowane owoce. W smaku jest wyraźnie kwaśno, ale też kwaśności towarzyszy też dość potężna słodycz. Zbyt potężna, bo piwo przez to staje się nieco zbyt mdłe, słodyczy jest więcej niż kwaśności. Wysycenie jest wysokie, mocno musujące, co wzmaga odczuwalną pełnię, ale i nieco przeszkadza w żołądku. Piwo smaczne, słodkie i kwaśne (bardziej słodkie), lekko dzikie. Mnie to nie zachwyca.
Fizzy apples, straightforward light medium sourness and fuller medium brown sweetness, not overwhelming, close to zero funk

Farbe: klar, kupfer 
Schaum: fein, schnell auf dünne schicht reduziert. 
Nase: hefe-sauer, fruchtig nach alten Äpfeln, leicht mostig nach Holzfass, Getreide.
Geschmack,: erstaunlich frisch und sprudlig, feinperlig, hinten im Mund süß und rund. Im Nachgeschmack sogar zuckerig. Über allem gleichmäßig der leicht bittere holzige apfelkellergeschmack. 
Jo ziemlich gut. Bisschen viel Süße.

Bottle at The Bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a clear amber colour with a thin white head. Aroma of green apple, wood, some grape, slight horseblanket, a hint of cherry, maybe marzipan and subtle candy sugar. Taste of green apple, wood, grape, some funk, slight cherry, a little blackcurrant, a hint of candy sugar and subtle tartness. Medium bodied, spritz carbonation and a slick texture. A dry, sweet and sour, fruity finish. A cider/perry styled lambic. Lots of apple, fruit and wild yeast. Good spritzy texture. Sweet but tasty.

Bottle from saveur-biere.com. Pours clear light red. Nose is acidic, marzipan, the acidity reminds me of cassis. Palate is refreshing, not sour at all, wood, fruity acidity. Pretty nice, like a non sour Gueuze.

Shared bottle. Clear amber colour, small off-white head. Aroma of grapes, champagne, light funk. Taste is medium- sweet and light sour, grape, apple, candy sugar, sour finish. Light to medium body, soft carbonation. Nice entry-level lambic.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Best before 2008, clear brown with almost no head. Aroma is horse blanket, lots of phenols and esters, some sweet cherry stuff, praline. Taste is incredibly sweet, some sour touch of more cherries. Not too heavy, still drinkable. Like an easy going lemonade, almost no carbonation. A sweet surprise. Nice.
Old bottle BB2008 Dark amber, low head. Musky horse blanket aroma. Medium full candyish body. Sweet base, honey, horsey, sparkly sweet. muggy sugary, cant claim it is a revelation.
Niezły smak pseudo szampaniczny fajna kwaśność bardzo owocowy smak. Jasna barwa z dosyć obfitą pianą.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2017 Świetne. Winogrona, owoce, delikatna kwaśność. Wytrawne, dzikie i niesamowicie przyjemne. Do tego delikatna "starość" końskiej derki i posmak delikatnie łodygowy. Nieodparte skojarzenia z kwaśnym kompotem od babci-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Aromat końskiej derki i kwasu, jakieś karmele i prażony słód w tle, trochę zapach wina. Kolor miedziany, bursztyn. Piana ładna, tworzy się wysoko, ale wkrótce opada do postaci pierścienia, nawet oblepia. Dość bogate w smaku - wytrawne jabłko, słodycz kandyzowana, słodycz karmelu, syropu, kwaśność owoców. Posmak dzikich drożdży. Dość ciekawy i ułożony w smaku lambik. Pijalność wysoka. Balansuje między półwytrawnym a półsłodkim. Godny polecenia.

Keg, 6DN. Pours brick red with no head. Scent is caramelized sweet and sour candy. Taste is consistent like warheads candy but more on the sweet side. Cant complain as the taste is nice. Finish is a bit skittles painful. Great.
Pierwszy Lambic. Napewno siegne po nastepne . Polecam wszystkim jako pierwszego lambica!

This is the first faro that Ive tried. The aroma is of wild (basement-ish) yeast, and also resembles champagne.As I sip, I notice brown sugar as well. The taste is actually not too sour, and relatively sweet (but less than fruit beers by this brewer). It has a very smooth finish. I like this beer and recommend it to anyone who already likes regular lambics.

Pours a clear coppery color with minimal off-white head. Wheat, sweetness, funk, yeast, and some light fruit on the nose; follows onto the palate. Light bodied. Finishes with a slight sweet-tart note.
24.12.2016 - Nice candy sweet and light sour simple lambic. No agressive acidity or disturbing edges. Good palate
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Barwa miedziano-czerwona, piana nikła. W aromacie dzikie, ciekawe, stajnia, wieś. W smaku słodycz miesza się z kwaskowatością i ta ostatnia dominuje na finiszu. Efekt fajny, zwłaszcza dla kobiet...
a wondeful beer, it pours into a clear dark body topped with a disappearing white head. the aroma is bready with an apple sweetness to it. the flavour is a true candy
Barwa czerwona, piana nikła. W aromacie owoce. W smaku słodycz miesza się z kwaskowatością.

Look: clear dark red, creamy beige unstable head.

Aroma: sour, fruity, light wild notes.
Taste is moderate to light sour balanced with sweetness.
Flavour: candied fruits, baked apples,burned sugar.

Very good.
Winery, very sweet with just a little bit of sour in the end to balance. A nice place to start with sour beers or simply something easy to drink.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Piwo jasnobrązowe brązowe, klarowne. Piany praktycznie brak. W aromacie kwaskowość, truskawka, róże. Ciekawe połączenie W smaku podobnie i słodko. Ciekawe. Wysycenie niskie.

Tap @ Délirium Café Amsterdam. Aroma of light brett and caramel. Clear brown colour with no head. Taste is light+ sour, light bitter and light+ sweet. Medium body, oily/dry feel, sweet and light brett finish.

Thanks DCLawyer for sharing the bottle! Poured into a snifter showing caramel brown and sparse rust tinged foam. 

The nose shows notes of sweet brett. 

The palate is full bodied and lightly carbonated. Moderately tart with a sweet cane sugar forwardness but moderately sweet and not overwhelming.

Bottle at home. Thanks to Theydon Bois for handing me a style rake. Pours clear amber with a thin white head. Aroma of green apples, brown sugar and a little funk. Taste is sweet up front, the green apple sour kicks in and balances out the sweetness. Nice carbonation. Nice enough but couldn?t drink lots of it.

On keg at Six Degrees North, Edinburgh. 
Appearance - golden amber with a nice fluffy head. 
Nose - wood and cherries. Apple cider vinegar dominant. 
Taste - apple liqueur going into apple vinegar again. 
Palate - close to medium bodied with a long lean tangy middle section that continues through the finish. Beautiful balance between sweet and sour.
Overall - ah this is gorgeous!

Bottle. Pours clear amber with fading offwhite head. Aroma has fruits like apples, some sweetness and sour bretty character. Taste is sweetish fruity with apple, light malt, brett and some sourness. Finish is dry fruity, with some sweetness.

25cl bottle from Sip, Tallinn, Pours clear amber with a modest off-white head. Farmyard, sour berries and sugar in the aroma. Sweet, funky and sour. Refreshing and quite enjoyable! Can easily have a bottle of this from time to time.

Keg @ Six North Opening Night. Pours amber. Nose is lemon, sweet citrus, candied glace cherry and other fruits. Sweet, big dollop of sweet tea, slightly sour aftertaste, this is odd, caramel, way too sweet for me.

(Bouteille provenant de Sunset Beer): Un liquide frustrant dune certaine façon. On perçoit bien la tendance Lambic, laspect mentholé au passage, qui tente de sétablir mais sétouffe rapidement dans le sucre candi. Le mélange est excessivement fruité et près du bonbon. Hautement plus difficile à boire quun Lambic.
Легкий аромат, приятны& вкус, послевк& с кислинк& и сладост& Пьется очень легко. (Bottle 0,25/ 4,5%)
375 cork and capped. Dingy orange yellow. Aroma is grape must. Taste is grape must, white grapes, champagne, lots of sweetness, low sourness.

355 ml bottle, undated as far as I can see, from Barriques in Fitchburg, WI, served at cellar temp from a Lindemans glass. Lots of liquid around the cork as it is extracted with a bit of difficulty...pours a dark amber, almost copper, with largish off-white bubbly head that dies very quickly....decent enough farmy nose, sour apples and a bit of manure and wet hay...body very sweet throughout, light underlying tartness, very little carbonation, watery, soft finish. I was excited to finally get to try a second Faro, but alas had to make do with this one; thats what you get in this lambic-poor area, sigh. Anyway as it warms up, theres some interesting smokiness towards the finish, and the tartness becomes just a wee bit more prominent, which is nice -- but its still almost undrinkably sugary, and simultaneously watery and syrupy. Gaaah.

Pours clear amber with a small white head, decent lacing. Wonderful if a bit sweetish aroma of roses, funk, light note of strawberries and raspberries, caramel/sugar, funk again, hints of spice and grapefruit. Taste is medium sweet-and-sour, with a tiny bit of grapefruit bitterness on finish. Medium carbonation and body, fairly sticky. Amazing aroma makes up for excessive (to my taste) sweetness, and probably a great one for fruity/sweet-and-sour lovers.

Barwa bursztyn/ciemne złoto, klarowne, piana niska. Aromat słodkawy, jest też trochę stajni (nieciekawy zapach), na końcu kojarzy się z winem. W smaku słodycz zakończona szampańską kwaskowatością. Goryczki brak. Ciekawie musuje na języku. Przez całą degustację odrzuca mnie jednak ten "stajenny" aromat.

Color marrón claro con reflejos anaranjados y capa de espuma blanca de menos de un dedo de grosor. Carbonatación a tope. Cuerpo medio (algo espesa, como beber azucar en formato líquido). Mezcla aromática, como de manzana ácida y manzana dulce. El sabor es similar, mezclando de manera precisa y convincente lo dulce y lo ácido. No entiendo por qué la gente dice que es una cerveza que no arriesga, porque para mí es más bien lo contrario. Tampoco entiendo a los que dicen que simplemente es dulce porque la acidez la puede captar hasta una persona sin paladar. Muy interesante.

Bottle. Pours brown in colour with big white head. Aroma of tart fruits, some wood, green apples and brown sugar. In taste sour-sweet with apples and grapes flavours mixed with sugary ones. Medium body, high carbonation, a bit cloying-sweet in the finish. A bit too sweet, but ok to drink.
355mL bottle poured into a tulip -- light brown, syrup looking. Its sweet and not very complex. Im not a huge fan.

Piana dosc szybko opada do zera. Aromat stajenny, kolokwialnie mówiąc, wali troszkę konskim plackiem. Mhmm, to co beergeecy lubią najbardziej. Lekko rumowy. W smaku dość kwaśne, słodkie, aż szczękają zęby. Zaskakująco rześkie i pijalne, jak na taką słodycz. Wysokie nasycenie. Pić z zatkanym nosem.
Flesje gedeeld met TomHendriksen (tht. 12 juli 2012). Amber kleurig, helder bier met weinig schuim. Aroma van kersen en rood fruit. Smaak is eveneens fruitig en wijnachtig. Nasmaak is licht bitter.
Fles gedeeld door Inoven, het bier heeft een heldere doch donker bruine kleur met weinig schuim. Het heeft een heerlijk zoet zure smaak.
Bottle. Light brown with short lasting head. Aroma is sour fruit and some wooden notes. Taste is sour fruits, some cara and sweet sugar. Nicely balanced between sweet and sour.

If you have a habit to add any juice to beer dont profane it any longer only start to drink Lindemans. Taste of this is interesting mix of sweetness which welcomes your tongue and acidity which seats on it widely like on couch.
Look of hazy brandy, no head. Aroma of grapes, white fruits, barnyard, leather. Fruity, winey, sweet and sour taste. A bit too sweet.
Fruity and sweet, woody, dried fruits, green apples. The finish is dry, sweet and fruity with woody notes.
the aroma of garden fruits, sweet wine, yeast and brown sugar... the taste is sweet and sour with notes of sour apple, plum, sweet wine, yeast and berries... the aftertaste is sweet, tart and sour...

Golden brown with an off white head which dissipates completely in a couple of minutes. Fruits an a little bit of funk in the aroma. Sweet and sour taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

250ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Clear golden brown colour, head instantly disappearing. Aroma: sweet, sugary malt. Taste sugary sweet, caramel slight fruity malt, with a sour finish. Sweetness a little cloying but otherwise a decent beer, first time trying a Faro though so dont know how it compares to others.

Mild sourness. Tastes a lot of candy sugar almost, mixed with caramel malts. All around decent beer, but just okay for a sour.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.75 l bottle shared with a friend. Pours orangeish color with no head.It was like a mid-sweet champagne both in aroma and taste with a fruity-sour finish that lasted for quite a long. It was my first beer of this kind, hence my points are a hundred percent subjective.
Généreuse, légère, sucrée, cette bière est originale : elle ne tombe pas dans lexcès de sucre et trouve léquilibre.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Cobre intenso con transparencia, sin espuma ni retención. Brett moderado-moderado alto, ésteres a frutos secos, maní, mazapán, diacetilo, malta maltoso caramelo moderado, lúpulo bajo-nulo. En boca Malta maltoso caramelo moderado, brett moderado bajo, ésteres a frutos secos, maní, toffe, mazapán, lúpulo de amargor nulo. Final ácido maltoso con untuosidad sin astringencia, cuerpo medio, baja carbonatación.

Nice lambic yeast with a fruity sweetness to it. Interesting combo of classic lambic with an odd sugary sweetness in the background. Immediate tartness balanced by and iced tea kind of sweetness. I like the lambic tartness but the sweet part is off putting. Definitely prefer the cuvee rene over this.

Clear amber-reddish colour, moderate frothy head that quickly vanishes away. The nose is funky with light fruity acidity. Light body. Average carbo. Soursweet taste. Fruity. Acidic. Funky. A light touch of caramel. Nice balance. Light fruit stone biterness ending it. Very decent.

Semmi hab, vöröses - narancssárgás szín. Illata aszalt gyümölcs és fűszerek keveréke. Intenzív ízvilágú, savanykás, édeskés-kandiscukros, grapefruitos ízvilág, tökéletes összhangban. Közepesen testes sör. Isteni, rendkívül finom, igazi frissítő nedű.

Barwa bursztynowa, klarowne. Piana drobnopecherzykowa, pozostawiaj?ca ?adny lacing. S?odki aromat, przypominaj?cy zapach wina. W smaku g?ównie owoce. Du?a s?odko?? piwa jest kontrowana przez delikatn? kwasowo??.Oczywi?cie nie ma goryczki.
 Ca?kiem pijalne, chocia? troch? zbyt s?odkie,ciekawa propozycja na lato, zw?aszcza dla pa?.

Small bottle. Ruby brown. Not much head. Lambic aroma but tastes like a sugar bomb. Meh. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaska från Brugge. Bärnstensfärgad med vit skumkrona. Doft av lambic och pomerans. Söt kropp. Söt smak av röda bär och lite rödvinsvinäger.
Flaska snabbköp, brygge. Orangeaktig kulör. Lätt söt doft av stall, citron och vinäger. Mycket söt smak. Funk, citron och jordkällare. Syrlig eftersmak

This Lambic was a nice balance between sour and bitter. This was our favorite overall for the flavor. Cheers!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bière brune avec fine mousse blanche. Elle sent le liège sûrement dû au bouchon. Au goût elle est acide et sucrée. Très bonne bière.

Yeasty, barnyard and sour scents. Pours a cloudy bright brown with a thin off-white head quickly dissipated. Huge round tastes of sour apple with sweet tart lingering finish. Oily mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Really nice arresting big flavors. I really like it.
Bottle. Amber, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly sour, light body, sticky, soft carbonation, & long finish.
bouteille 75 cl - couleur ambrée assez sombre, odeur boisée, de sucre, goût sucré sur le sucre candi, une légère acidité, fruité et boisé, bonne mais peut vite devenir écoeurante

Served in a tulip from a 375ml bottle. Pours amber colour with a thick off-white head. Aroma is bread, apple, yeast, caramel and mango. Taste is apples, yeast, sharp sour-sweet with some bitterness. Medium body with lively carbonation. Very nice Belgian Sour!!!
Restrained aroma in a reddish copper pour. Tart taste to start is soon joined by a sweet body to balance and makes for a refreshingly different beer.

Pours clear dark amber with thin, short-lived, white head. Acetic and sweet nose, reminding some red and black berries. Taste is very sweet and medium sour. Light body, soft carbonation. I cant drink more than 25cl.
Bottle 25cl. Pours golden, clear, small head. aroma of champagne, sour apple. Taste of champagne, apples, sour cherries, sugar, hint of vinegar.

Bottle from Great Grog, Edin. Pours reddish amber with a brief sight of head and effervescence leaving a flat looking glass. Aroma is not entirely pleasant. Cheesy feet. Bit of sick. Old, wet wood. Red berries. Mulling spice. A little medicinal. All over the place but the some of its parts is not for me! Taste has a red-flavoured candy soda sweetness to start. Some lactic cheek tweaking notes come in. Lightly sour. More tart. That candy sweetness is too much. Very, very light carbonation. Medium to light body. Not. For. Me.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2016 Bottle at matroz kocsma. Dark amber colour, small white head disappears immediately. Nose is semi dry champagne. Taste is medium to high sweetness with low biterrness. Overall a semi-dry (or semi sweet) champagne. Shame I dont like semi sweet champagne.
Ciemnoczerwone, wyraźna piana, w aromacie słodko i owocowo, coś pomiędzy winem a oranżadą, w smaku owocowo, słodko i kwaśno, bardzo przyjemne

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2017 Piwo nalewa sie bez piany. Klarowne w kolorze ciemny bursztyn - jasny rubin. W smaku aromat slodko kwasny. Jak wino z brandy tylko nie tak alkoholowo. Lekka nuta octowa. Troche stajni i z owocow jakby wisnie. W smaku bardziej slodko niz kwasno ale bardzo fajnie to pasuje. Srednie wysycenie czuc bardzo przyjemnie na jezyku i podniebieniu. Goryczka minimalna. Piwo lekkie i mega pijalne.

Bottle. Pours a clear orange copper, thin whitish head, minor lace spots. Nose is sweet, fruity, a little funky. Tastes sweet, tart, a little honey and some ginger too. Really quite tasty and different.

37,3 cl bottle from Bierzwerg bottle shop, Greven. Nearly copper in the glass with a small head. Sweet sour on the nose with some resin notes. Taste has fruity sourness with a parallel sweetness. Refreshing. Really really nice.

Acquired via trade with Chopz. 37.5cl bottle. 4.5%. Pours a fairly big foamy bubbly off-white head and has a reddish amber appearance with sediments clearly visible. Lacing is ok. Aromas are quite varied, some sour notes, cherries, dry fruits, finishes with what can only be described as humid basement aroma. Wow. Flavours are all over the place. Its sweet, slightly sour, some tarty notes, some hints of apples. Cherries, sweet and caramel malts, a bit yeasty. Well balanced sweetness and bitterness. Slight drying sensation on the palate.

Dark amber to nearly copper in color. Moderate, but stable aged paper colored head. Sweet malt, light apple, touch of tart cherry, and hints of hop sack and barnyard. Has a bit too much sweetness for me. Holy crap is this stuff sweet. Hints of oak and light syrup dominate the front. Lightly tart in the finish and linger. Not quite refreshing. Not a bad dessert. A touch sticky in feel. 4/10

Na początku mocny aromat bardzo przyjemny, nieco stajenny, owocowy. Barwa bursztynowa, nieco zamglone, piana nikła, która szybko ginie. W smaku kwaśne, fajne, stajenne, owocowe. Ogólnie krótko mówiąc; świetne piwo.
@ Hotel Mirabeau, Brussels 20160506. Bottle from local beer shop. Fruity and sweet, woody, dried fruits, green apples. The finish is dry, sweet and fruity with woody notes.

Butelka 250ml, barwa bursztynowa, klarowne, piana nikła, zostaje obrączka przy krawędzi szkła, bardzo ładnie się prezentuje. Aromat bardzo wyrazisty, trochę octowy, stajenny, lekko słodkawy, przywodzi nieco na myśl zielone jabłko. W smaku jest początkowo delikatna kwaśność (jak na lambica), która powoli ustępuje miejsca delikatnej słodyczy. Do tego bomba posmaków stajennych i owocowych. Bardzo delikatna kontra goryczkowa na końcu. Piwo jest bardzo lekkie, ale jednocześnie wyraziste, idealny balans.

Great Lambic with Large pallet and film body, slightly bitter aftertaste. One of the best in its kind!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice bottle!!!!
An amber clear beer, short head, buttersotch, a good balance between sour and sweet with more sweetness, finish is sweet
(I have a 0.375l bottle with batch L:BA06PFA and best-before 06 Jan 2018)

My first lambic sharzie from RD. Had to decide to rate this according to whether I liked the taste. My inexperience means I could not judge its appropriateness to style. Red wine, tarte vinegar, sweet malt. Nice on salty chips but gave me heart burn.
Bottle from local kiosk in brussels. Pours a bronze like beer with a small head. Fruity, sweet and bretty. Dry finish.

La Lindemans Faro est une bière de blé (froment) de fermentation spontanée et au goût aigre-doux parfaitement équilibré par l'ajout d'une dose supplémentaire de sucre candi. Elle présente une robe de couleur rouge-orangée qui se surmonte d'une fine couche de mousse blanche.
La Lindemans Faro révèle des arômes boisés et aigre-doux de fruits, de fruits secs, de caramel et de sucre candi. On retrouve en bouche une pointe d'acidité qui s'accompagne de saveurs douces et sucrées de fruits, ainsi que de légères touches boisées.

First rating for the Faro style. Not that easy to find as RateBeer shows only 16 active examples of the style. 375 ml bottle purchased at Beverage Warehouse while on a business trip to Los Angeles some 19 months ago ($6.99). POURS a nice sun-brewed tea color, like a deep sunset orange/amber with two fingers of effervescent white foam. AROMA of a not-too-tart vinaigrette, some musty basement, wet oak, a bit of stewed dark fruits, and some red wine thats been sitting out for too long. FLAVOR of wine-y vinegar, nice berry / fruit touches (strawberry, raspberry, perhaps peach and apricot), mild brown sugar, simple syrup, with some bits of tart funk. I expected something more tart on the tongue, but the added brown sugar does come in to make this a less puckering affair. I wonder if the aging has decreased the sweet content. First experience of this style, and it was pleasant enough (dont find it cloying like many of the other raters). (1538, 1024)

Shared 12 oz. bottle. Amber with a white head and plenty of particles floating around. Aroma is tart, vinous, fruity and sweet. Taste is sour, fruity, malty, vinegar, and very sweet. Has an exceptionally sweet candied sugar finish. Overall, its a bit strange.

Bottle from Humlen Ølutsalg, Bergen. Pours a near-clear light amber body with a small white head. Aroma is bretty funk tones, dark sugars, grains, wine cork, nuts, hay and hints of lactic sourness and lemon zest. Taste is cola bean, lemon zest, dark sugars and hints of funk, caramel and minerals. Light body, high carbonation. A strange mixture of sweet and sour, dark nutty sugary tones and bretty funk notes. Interesting, and quite likeable.

duft: sødlig æblejuice frisk sødlig 
smag sødlig æblejuice frisk svag syrlig

Aroma: mostly malt with only small a note of sour fruitiness; Appearance: dark amber with significant amount of particulates floating around; Im a little scared; very thin head that dissipates quickly; Taste: basically like cherry kool-aid; extreme sweetness with a sour finish; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: not sure if its the style or the beer, but definitely not my favorite.
Its made from malt, wheat, hops, water, yeast. Candy sugar is added before the bottling takes place. It is a clear, light red colored faro lambic with a small, creamy head.

Deep amber, cristal clear, tiny white head, which is like youd expect from sour beer. In aroma it has some lambic sourness, but also there is a lot of sweetness, more even suggary than malty. Smells nice, quite pleasant. In taste its very weird. First its so sweet, like a sweet soda with addition of even more sugar. But than the sweetness completely disappears, like in one moment. In that moment it feels like quite a decent lambic. But unfortunately the sweetness is still on your lips and on your thong, which makes it sweet again. The mouth feel is ok, but only on the sour phase. In other moments its just to sticky, its not that refreshing as I was thinking itll be. My first faro, weird beer.
Smell like wine Bubbly, lots of carbonation Sweet Yellow brownish in color Interesting beer!

UPDATED: APR 22, 2016 Barwa złoto-pomarańczowa z różnymi jesiennymi przebłyskami. Piana bardzo ładna, biała, drobnopęcherzykowa, wolno opadająca, średnia, niski lacing. Mocno nagazowane. W aromacie słodycz i dzikość, pachnie kwaśno, jakby wodą z ogórków kiszonych. W smaku jest słodkie i kwaśne jednocześnie  coś jak soczek wiśniowy (imo) dosładzany. Bardzo pijalne.

Aroma of sour fruit, citrus, wood, must. In taste again wood, must, with tartness of old apples and sugary sweetness. Interesting beer that is nicely balanced between sour- and sweetness, though a little bit rough and artificial in sweetness.

Rating #1125, flaske fra The Bottle Shop i Brügge  

Min 1125de rating, men endnu er der øltyper jeg ikke har læsket min gane i, og en af dem, er faro. Det bliver spændende at se, hvad der byder sig. Øllet er let tåget teaktræsfarvet og med et hvidt, boblende skum, der forsvinder hurtigt. Syrlig duft som forventet og underligt nok en smule champignon og kælder/gær. Syrlig smag med en del røde bær og blommer, samt masser af sødme, og tidligere nævnte fugtige kælder. Rigtig lækker smag egentlig - og dejligt forfriskende - især da jeg havde frygtet noget geuze-lignende, som jeg bestemt ikke er begejstret for (i øvrigt den eneste øltype jeg bevidst går uden om, udover berliner weisse). Blød og tiltalende mundfølelse, der ikke er helt tynd. En positiv overraskelse, og jeg vil prøve at finde nogle flere faroer, selvom det ikke er en øltype man falder over hver dag.

Barwa jasnobrązowa, piwo klarowne, piana bez szału. Zapach przywodzi na myśl trochę jabola, a trochę białe wino. Smak to przede wszystkim kwaśne, zielone jabłka. Kwaśność fajnie wyczuwalna, wyraźna, ale nie wykrzywia. Niezłe.

Bottle received in the local European swap, thanks to SinH4. Hazy hazelnut brown with a large off white/beige head. Dust, dessert wine, wood, mold in the nose. Flavour has light caramel, syrup, paper, light wood, mold. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, sweet with little sourness to balance. Long sweet finish. Not my thing.
Helles braun schöner schaum, Geruch leicht fruchtig säuerlich, auch im Geschmack leichte säure leichte frucht wenig Malz angenehmer Abgang

Aromat kwaskowy z wyraźnymi nutami belgijskimi. 
Trochę nut kandyzowanego cukru. 
Owocowe, kwaśne w aromacie. 
W smaku słodko-kwaśne. Przypomina posłodzone, kwaśne jabłka. 
Dość pełne w odczuciu. Kwaskowość nie bardzo wysoka, ale wyraźna. 
Dobre, pijalne.

Bottle. Aroma is brown sugar with a hint of sourness. Pours a dark amber colour with small head. Moderate carbonation. Flavour is tart with notes of apple with some nicely balanced sweetness. Smooth bodied. Sweetness dominates the sour in the finish.
Bottle, 250 ml, shared with JFK10000. Pours clear orange, almost no head. Sugary sweetish, caramel, malty, juicy, some fruit. Sourish finish. First Faro.
Botella 33 cl tomada en el Lupulo enero 2007. (r1521). Fcpref 23..11..2008. Lote LK23FFA030558. belga original buena en su estilo con 4 vol. Para repetir.

Funky aroma, like basements or dank caves or maybe blue cheese. Has a orange juice-like sourness with touches of honey flavor. Both sweet and tart. Almost too sweet, but it is a good "starter" beer for sours. Nice funky, brett finish. Interesting style. Good with desserts and some spicy foods.

From tap at Les Berthom Lyon V, Lyon. Unclear golden color with off white head. Nice yeasty and malty aroma, light funky and wood, fruity, caramel, honey. Quite sweet taste, honey, citrusy fruity. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottle, random street in Anderlecht, march 12th 2015. Light brown body, fizzy gushing white head. Aroma is sour with fruit candy and toffee. Taste is acidic, a sharp sour start is catched up by a sweet caramel and fruit note, while maintaining a mellow funky feel. Finish is sugary, just a nod too much.

Bottle into a tulip. Pours a clear medium brown, with a small tan head that quickly fades. Nose is candi sugar, cherries,and caramel, and the taste follows. Rather sweet, but not cloying. Nice as a dessert beer or as a change of pace, but not something youd want a lot of.

Bottle from Seijo. Sugar really dominates, feels like candy cane in a brew, notes of caramel, cherry and berries, finish is sweet without being overly cloying. Definitely not my style, and probably not the best example...
Bonito acobreado e agradavel carbonataçao. O primeiro gole remeteu a um fresco chardonnay. Agradaveis sabores florais e citricos. Muito agradável, recomendo

Bottle 0,25L. Hazy orange color with small, fizzy, off-white head, that turns to a small crown fast. Specific aroma reminds me mostly of sour fruits, wine and vinegar. Very intensive aroma, but not really pleasant to me. Taste starts as a combination of sweet and acidic, but it turns to heavy acidic fast with a noticeable cherry touch and long lasting aftertaste. Interesting experience.

Bottle, gift from Simonsen, enjoyed at home
Rusty brown, thin white head. Smell of funk, forrest berries, caramel, malts, hints of vitamin C. Heavy sweet, fruity flavors, berries, a bit artifical, some funk and must. Moderate bitter. Quite ok, but ive tried better faros
Aroma of wine, vinegar, cherries and a bit of wood. Taste is lightly sour with a bit too much sweetness and no bitterness and noticeable caramel and red fruits.

25 cl, bottled. BB 03 JUN 2016. Pours nearly clear orange with a small disappearing white head. Aroma Toasted notes, toffee. Caramel. Taste: Sweet, pleasant acidity. Toffee, caramel. Milky tones. Palate: Light body, notable carbonation. Dry aftertaste. Nice one.

Bursztynowe, prawie klarowne piwo o słabej pianie, która dość szybko redukuje się do zera. Aromat umiarkowanie intensywny, kwaskowy. W smaku słodkie z mocną kwaskową kontrą, wiem że dodawanie cukry to nie jest to co tygrysy lubią najbardziej, ale tu po prostu smak mnie powala, słodkie a jednocześnie kwaskowe, porównał bym to do mega kontry chmielowej w piwie z dużym ekstraktem coś, jak Pinta Quatro, tylko tu słodycz kontruje nie chmiel, a kwaśność. Goryczka niska, ale zastępuje ją kwaskowy posmak. Ogólnie piwo wygrywa smakiem, który bardzo mi podszedł, reszta nie jest już tak udana, ale i tak oceniam je bardzo dobrze.
Mah, sweet and sugary with some off balance sourness to it. Seems like a sour beer with too much sugar added.

At Bruges Beer Fest. Pours clear dark orange/amber with a creamy beige head. In the aroma you find brown sugar, yeast, wheat, cherry and blackberry. Tastes heavy sweet with a sour ending. Oily texture and soft carbonation. Nice drink.
Shiny orange amber. Extremely sweet caramel flavor. Paired with intense sour and horsey flavors. Very complex.

My first faro. Bottle from Market Street Wine Shop downtown.

Pours a pretty deep amber with a sizable beige head. Smells of a black tea with added fruit flavor, sweetened. Perhaps blackberry. Taste is also similar to a sweetened black tea. Very sweet with a bitter bite underneath, lemon juice inside the black-blackberry tea with some sugary notes. Tasty.

Bouteille verte, avec bouchon de liège, de 375 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie au coût de 8,00$. Arôme: Odeur dagrumes sucrées. Apparence: La couleur est cuivrée avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dagrumes sûrettes avec une pointe de pommes vertes. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement vineuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement fruité. (Rating #6717)

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka 0.75, warka do 7-12-2016. bursztynowe, opalizujace, z poczatkowo wysoka piana, szybko opadajaca. aromaty - tu zaskoczenie - dominuje funky... jest tez owocowosc jasna taka (morele?), winne jakies nutki. w ustach szmapano-winno-kwaskowato-slodkie. naadal owoce i dzikosc. przyznam sie, ze z jednej strony jestem zaskoczony sila tej dzikosci, a z drugiej szkoda tego poslodzenia. wysoko wysycone. ma swoj ewidentny urokOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Darker golden orange, slight opacity, minimal white head; dissipates quickly. Very sweet sugary nose, hint of bright cherry, slight funk, slight tartness. Again, very sweet, but significantly more sour than the nose would suggest. Quite oily, medium body, really coats the palate and just stays. Good, could be great after a few years in the cellar.

Serving: from bottle purchased at The Beer Junction.

Aroma: moderate yeast, citrus, floral aroma.

Appearance: average-sized, frothy, off-white, initial head with no lacing and mostly diminishing longevity. Clear, light-orange body.

Taste: lightly sour/sweet initial flavor and finish with short duration.

Palate: light body, oily texture and lively carbonation.

Overall: soda-like and easy to drink.

Pours nice reddish colour. Sugar comes up in aroma, as well as sourness and some juice notes. In taste sour notes are noticeable, but the taste of brown sugar suppresses down the regular lambic style taste. Not bad, but can be better.
From Alcampo. In Teku glass. Reading CPPHTP10 Ch11. Adding sugar makes it less disgusting than a pure lambic but doesnt make it good either. At least I could finish it.
Przyjemne, jako ciekawostkę można wypić. Kwaskowe w smaku.----

Clear molten wax/amber color with small coffee froth foam. Aromas are very fruity, sugary and sweet. Sour/sweet red berries dominate the aromas and it is quite complex I would say. Palate, Medium body, dry and sticky texture coating the mouth with dry sweet finish that does not last for too long although it is highly carbonated. Taste is sweet, sour with a dry edge to it and tastes like dry.sweet cider and fermented carbonated berries. Overall interesting, unusual beer, very sweet and dry. Worth a try.
Minimal trübes rötliches Bernstein mit wenig Schaum. Säuerlich, fruchtig, Zuckersüß, trocken.
37.5cl bottle from Rustans Supermarket. My first faro lambic. Addictive sour aroma. Pours amber with medium head. Sour, vinegary taste. Not too shabby
Bottle. Pours yellow with minimal head. Aroma of fruity dessert, raisins, vanilla, cider, skunk, port. Taste is very port-like, very sweet, medium to full bodied, very rich. Overall, meh.

Sample from a 37.5cl bottle (26 IX 2015), shared with De Meetjeslandse Bierproevers. A modest faro styled lambic beer of Lindemans, from a typical gueuze bottle with crown cork and cork bung. This brew colours amber to orange, and this hazy lambic is topped with a white collar. Good looking for sure. The flavours are omnipresent, with lots of peach, grassy and lemon hops, "stable" yeaste and honey notes. These features make up for a heavy sweet and medium sour brew. This Lindemans is the archetype faro to me - a style of which I have some mixed feelings. This brew has a medium body with (too) sweet finish. Not bad, but almost unnatural sweet.

Bottle at home. Pours bit hazy amber/brownish with a shy ring of foam. Aroma of cellar, cardboard, explosive sweets (jawbreaking sweet), sugarcane, damp hay, caramel. Very sweet and with a sharp an strong sour spike at the same time. Body is medium, no really specific texture, bit sticky of the sweets. Not really into this.
Golden brown color, tiny off-white head. Brown sugar nose, vinegar, overripe fruit. Heavy sweet taste, sour notes, earthy, hints of spice and raisins. Light body, soft carbonation.
Bottle 375 ml, pours clear amber with white fast falling head. Aroma of caramel, fruits, flowers, candy and barnyard. High sweetness and medium sourness. Nice but a bit to sweet.

Shiny red cognac-like colour. Aroma: vinegar, redcurrants, raw apples. Raw apples and some currants also in the first taste. The sourness changes into sweetness of the currant and raspberry jam. Aftertaste brings cherries into mind. Light-bodied, medium carbonated, sour, then quite sweet and robust lambic.

Rating #1467 - 19.02.2015 Bottle from @beerblast - A sought after style tick. Not a sought after style for me. Pours a reddish brown, quite dark, with a bubbly white head that peters away quickly. Aroma is demerara sugar, yeast. Palate is just dominant sweetness for me - that rich brown sugar takes away any of the sour notes of the lambic, kind of a 1-dimensional lambic soda pop.

Bottle at The Fiddler, Den Haag. Poured a clear medium amber with a round bubbly white head. The aroma is yeast, acid citrus. The flavour is moderate sweet, light sour with a light, crisp, bubbly sweet citrus palate. Light bodied with average carbonation.

Both aroma and flavour similar to medium quality sparking wine.... Just a bit sweeter and less carbonation. Nothing good about that. Its better than Sowietskoje Igristoje still wont buy this one again ;p
Bottle. Clear orange color, almost no head. Light barnyard aroma, some candy, wine, caramel. Taste is medium sweet, light sour. Flavor of sugar, sweet grapes, caramel.
Bottle - Surprisingly good, as I didnt know what to expect from that mix of sour and sweet. Loved it.

Aroma:

Malts, sweet, caramel, sour, fruit.

Appearance:

Amber/brown beer with a small off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts heavy sweet with carameland fruit; ends slightly sour with lambic.

Low carbonated with nice foam. In aroma raisins, crust of bread and white dry wine sourness. In taste there is perfect connection between white wine sourness and sweetness coming from fruits like peach, grapes, raisins. Very nice beer.

barnyard, tart, citruses. quite a typical, but nonetheless lovely aroma. 
amber, slightly hazy, minimal head, white foam. Tate was light to medium sourness, light sweetness, tart, barnyard, again citruses. Very enjoyable. Palate: light body, slick feel, lively, long finish, that is quite pleasant. 
A very drinkable beer, lovely balanced. Could use some extra flavour and aroma notes.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2016 Bottle 0,25l. Copper colour with small quickly disappearing head. Aroma is sour winey with a hiding sweetness. Medium sourness, basement aromas. Light body, light carbonization. Yeast and sourness in the finish. Not my cup of tea. Im not a huge fan of lambic beers.

Arômes, boisé, légumes cuits, roti, whiski apparence cuivre, goût très sucré, raisin, palais très agréable, bière dans mes goûts qui change, très bonne bien quun peu trop sucré, risque dêtre écoeurante proche dun soda

Aroma:wine-like aroma,caramel note combined with hints of barnyard and lactic sourness.some grapes in the back.
Appearance:light amber color,clear,small frothy white head.
Taste:It begins with sugary flavour combined with caramel and medium to low souness,caramely finish,sour aftertaste.
Palate:medium body,high carbonation.
Overall:Very refreshing and drinkable beer.Nice everyday lambic.
Clean amber. Thin head with high retention. Aroma intensity 3.5/5. Sour aroma with notes of tomato, thyme and hazelnut. Medium to heavy sweet well wrapped up with sour. Medium body

The smell of sweet fruits and berries, very little yeast notes.
In taste the sweetness of sugar and raspberry sour green apple, against the backdrop of a small bitterness.
At the finish flashing sweetness wheat and yeast, long stretches pleasant sour-sweetness.
Bottle from Drinkshop. Very nicely balanced beer, with the sweetness just adequately softening the otherwise clean sour and bretty funky character. Very easy drinking, very refreshing and very tasty.

Clear copper colored beer with a cream colored head. Sweet & tart, like cherries with a dank, basement funky sourness. Very sweet up front but has that lovely sourness only found by spontaneous fermentation. Overall, quite tasty but just over the top with the sugary sweetness. Still, I do like this one, my 74th style rated!

Slightly sweet and sour as well with a slightly bitter finish. Very enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Bierlieb. Very sweet and clean, almost artificial and quite a bit like a sweet cider. Low funk. A very easy type of lambic, but too sweet for my taste, not quite refreshing anymore.
Schöne 37,5cl Flasche mit Kork-Verschluss. Helles Kastanienfarbenes Bier mit feinem Schaum. Süss-säuerlicher Duft. Beeren und Kräuter. Geschmack säuerlich frisch. Lecker!
Aroma is sour and vinous. Taste is sweet, but also noticable sourness. Low bitterness. A little bit too sweet for me.

Aroma: Light sour vinegar, fresh sappy red berry juice, dust, yeast.
Flavor: Red raspberry/red cherry, hint of sour vinegar, wheat/yeast.
Comment: Balanced but leans toward the sweet side.

Bottle, 25 cl. Clear dark copper body with a short white head. Very sour aroma. Rather sweet taste with high acidity, fairly well-balanced according to my preferences. It has some of the same flavours as the gueuze, although not as pronounced. Light body with average carbonation. The finish is dominated by the lambic notes. This is the first faro I have tried, and I think it is quite good.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2015 Bottle. Dark amber color with small-medium head. Aroma of sweet dates mixed with some dust, barrel, vanilla, dark fruitsand porto. Gorgeous. Flavor profile is almost the same, not so complex, with more pronounced sweetness and apples . Actually with time it tastes more like apple juice than lambic. Sweet finish. Overall: really nice. Maybe too sweet even for style but still a great beer.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2015 On Tap . @Cimmeria, Oviedo 06/11/2015
Color ámbar, sabor agrio, frutal, cuerpo medio, fácil de beber.

Pours reddish copper. Large carb bubbles. Rapidly vanishing tan head. Aroma is caramel, red apple, strawberry, fig leaf, candy. Taste is fizzy, sweetish and much sour. No bitterness. Medium lasting finish.

Tiny, fizzy, white, fully diminishing head, virtually no lacing. Normal, light amber body. Light malty aroma, with notes of cookie. Light hoppy aroma, with notes of flowers and perfume. Moderate yeasty aroma, with notes of barnyard, leather and earth. Notes of apple, cherry, raspberry and white wine. Heavy sweet, light bitter and light acidic initial flavor. Average, heavy sweet, moderate bitter, moderate acidic and acetic (vinegar) finish. Light body. Watery texture. Lively carbonation. Light alcoholic, light astringent finish.
Copper color, small head. A: sour apples, sour prune, some basement funk. T: sweet, mostly apple, apple juice, orange. Mildly sour development. Aftertaste is apples.

piwo ma kolor ciemnobursztynowy;lekko metne,piana biala,szybko opadajaca,nasycone dosc slabo,zapach cytrusowy,troche konskiej derki,smak slodko kwaskowy,niczym sie nie wyroznia pod zadnym wzgledem,ot typowe piwo w swoim gataunku

355ml corked bottle from Woodmans in Waukesha. Amber garnet pour with a white head leaving spotty lace. Aroma has tangy spices, pears, other fruits, some leather. Interesting. Funky. Taste is of simple syrup, apples, pears, some berries and grainy wheat on a solid sweet malt bill. Light to medium bodied with little alcohol presence. Finishes sweet tangy and quite dry. Interesting. Looking for a tick, yet it was enjoyable enough too. 12.8

On draft at HopCat. The pour is a brown-ish amber color with no head and no lace as the glass empties. The aroma is surprisingly good. It's like a cherry apple juice. There isn't any tart skin, just a juice blend. The flavor is very similar, until the finish. Then it goes to a moldy funk that it doesn't really recover from. The mouth feel is non-carbonated and syrupy. There is a lingeringly medicinal apple finish and it's just not that great. I'm hoping other Faros are much better 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 0.25l from Delhaize supermarket Gent Belgium 04.08.2015.Pour it clear dark amber color with small white head.Aroma chess nuts.Taste sweet strawberry, good balanced, oinvh of dourness on the end.

F: white, minimal very thin, very quick diminishing.
C: hazy dark amber.
A: citrus, vinegar, hint of funky and barnyard.
T: orange sweet sour, astringent, tones of cider like, hint of wood, caramel, very refreshing and good.
How: Bottle Appearance: clear deep golden, small white head. Aroma: candy, citrus peel, dried fruits. Palate: light body, average carbonation.

Aromat: kwaśny, białe owoce.   Wygląd: piana szybko znika, klarowne, bursztynowe.
Smak: kwaśny, owocowy.

Aroma is berry musty woody. Appearance is brownish dark orange red with medium small fizzy off white head. Taste is berry forward and tart quickly followed by sugary sweetness. Some woodsy mustiness lingers. Vinegar lingers. Palate is crisp but sweet. Tartness lingers with a bit of sugar. Overall an interesting beer. Beer is nice and has a real depth that is interesting. Alot of backsweetening though which isnt bad... but covers some of the flavors up.
Butelka. Aromaty jabłek, owocowe, już lekko kwaśne w aromacie. W smaku kwaśne. Po prostu dobre, trochę likierowe.

Aroma is sour, dank, light. Appearance is rust, white head. Taste is sweet, which was surprising, then a little dank and sour, mostly tastes like apple juice. Mouthfeel is thin, heavy carbonation. Overall, this is an interesting style.

Pours a fairly clear dark orange body with a quickly settling white head. Nose has some lovely sour berry, fruit, and yeast notes. Taste is quite sweet but a hefty tartness balances it nicely. Lively carbonation with large bubbles and light palate. After the initial shock this is quite nice and interesting.

0.75 l bottle from Pivoteka Zagreb. Shared with Vi?nja and Goran. Thanks! Blue cheese, cider, wine, dry fruits. Full taste, cellar aroma, sour bite, then sweet finish. Dry fruits. Medium body. Pleasant.

Not a lot of arome. Color is nothing special and absence of foam is normal for a lambic. The taste is very good and smooth. Not too acid as many lambic. Beeing not a fan of lambics beer, this one is maybe the best lambic I ever tasted.

Tap, Labeerynt, Gdańsk. Poziomkowy aromat tego piwa byłby bardzo przyjemny gdyby poziomki nie były sfermentowane. Piłem je wczoraj ale dopiero teraz przy opisie nasunęło mi się skojarzenie z bidonem, który przeleżał po szkolnej wycieczce w podstawówce kilka dni z niedopitą resztką kompotu. W smaku fajne połączenie delikatnej kwaśności z nienachalną słodyczą (niestety poziomki siały ferment w nozdrzach).
Albo to piwko jest nieudane albo po prostu to nie mój styl.

Bottle. Pours amber to brown, with a finger thick creamy head. Aroma is nice funky farmhouse, with notes of wood, leather and nuts. Full body, with soft carbonation. Flavour has an initial light tartness, followed by sweet notes of kandi, wood, wine gums and nuts. A tad too sweet, but still has nice funky notes.

Maker: Lindemans Brewery, St Pieters Leeuw-Vlezenbeek, Belgium ***
Beer: Lindemans Faro (bottled, unfiltered, 250ml) ***
Style: Lambic ***
ALC.VOL.: 4.5% ***

"Its made from malt, wheat, hops, water, yeast. Candy sugar is added before the bottling takes place. It is a clear, light red colored faro lambic with a small, creamy head. " [brewery note] ***
 
Colour: Deep, hazy amber. No head. ***
Nose: Intense tangy passion fruit, vinegar, yeast. ***
Texture: Medium body, hardly watery. Modest carbonation. ***
Taste: Fruit bomb, fruit bomb - youre my fruit bomb ... Intense orange flavor, plus balsamico vinegar, but mostly fruity/sweet (they add candy sugar for a reason). Yeast. Some mild spices. Middle is more sour, mostly lemony and yeasty. Finish is the same, candy sugar comes to the front in the after taste. ***

Impressions: Not a big fan of artificially adding sugar to the beer, but in the context of lambic it just works. The fruitiest beer Ive ever tasted. The vinegar and lemon prevent it from becoming cloying. A special beer, to be sure, but one that should be tried.
Zoetzuur, zoete smaak van kandijsuiker met zachtzurige afdronk. een zeer speciaal biertje.

Bonne bière fruitée, au col de mousse petit mais persistant avec une belle couleur cuivrée claire. Au nez elle ressemble fortement à la Kriek, une odeur de cerise avec une note boisée et caramel. Au goût cest sans hésitation une bière fruitée, légèrement acidulée mais contre balancé par lajout de sucre candi. Un fin pétillant en bouche qui laisse un joli arrière-goût boisé et de noix.
Bonne bière qui pourrait plaire davantage aux femme je pense, et saccompagne à merveille avec un dessert sucré

Clear read beer with a strong vinegar smells but once you tast it its a whole ne world in the mouth. Great belgian candy taste wit a soft balsamic vinegar taste. Great taste, not something you find often in Quebec!
Het herkenbare aroma van lambiek, met zijn azijn-fruitige lagen. Amberkleurig bier, met kleine schuimlaag. De smaak is zoet-zuur; de balans schiet iets uit in de richting van het karamelachtige zoet.
Pretty nice stuff. I like what the candy sugar does to this. Tangy citrus and fine passion fruit. Pours brown with good head and lacing. Light tangy sweet finish. Good balance. Bottle.

Bottle. Thanks rayaron! Clear copper amber with a big head. Aroma of apples, vinegar, wood, yeast, green leafes, funky and sweet. Taste - sweet, flavors of apples, white wine, grapes, apricots, yeast, dry and tart finish. Light-medium bodied, medium carbonatio, sticky, very dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Bottle 37.5cl. Slightly hazy copper with small off-white head. Sourish aroma, notes of apple and wood, yeasty and funky. Sweetish flavor followed by nice sourness, very dry, notes of apple and unripe apricot, a bit woody with interesting yeasty character, long sourish finish. Lively carbonation, light to medium-bodied. Very nice and fun to drink.

beige murky beer with off-white creamy head.
Aroma: light, acidy, very light.
Taste: high sweetness, light sour. Very sugary.
Palate: medium body, low carbonation.
Overall: tooooooo sweeeeeet.

Sampled from a 25cl bottle with a strength of 4.5% ABV. Amber colour with a hint of reddish pink. Whitish head and low carbonation. Aromas of cherry and apple. Rather sweet with a taste of cherries and boiled sweets, and a hint of vinegary sourness. Pleasantly refreshing with quite strong flavours and a surprisingly good mouthfeel. An interesting style of beer. Definitely refreshes the palate!

Pours amber with a relatively short lived off white head. Cherry, raspberry, apple, sugar, vinegar, funk and oak aroma. Sugar, cherry, raspberry, vinegar, funk, wood and biscuit flavors. Medium light body and moderate carbonation. Sugar, cherry and funk finish. A bit too much sugary sweetness.

11.08.2015, 0,375l bottle @ hotel room in Balestrand:
Nice slightly fizzy-creamy shortlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry fruity, old rope, sugar, old cellar, grass, soda powder, hints of peach. Taste is slightly sour-ish sweet, soda powder, sugar, grass, old cellar, sour fruits, old rope. Medium bitterness, slightly dry and acidic mouthfeel. Nice enough, refreshing.

Amber color with almost no head. Aroma is a combination of caramel, tart fruits and a hint of balsamic vinegar. Taste starts a bit sweet with some caramel and dark sugar and gets fruity and tart in the finish. It resembles a sweet flanders style ale more than a lambic. Overall its nice, easy drinking beer with a good amount of complex flavors.

L:
-pours a clear amber with a small to medium,quickly dissipating,foamy,white head
-tiny particle floaties
-no carbonation visible
S:
-wheat,lemon,old barn,leather
T:
-wheat,lemon,lime,orange,sugar
 carbonation
-light to medium body
O:
Fruitier than i though.Really nice warm weather beer

Dorata molto carica, abbastanza limpida, discreta persistenza della schiuma, di colore bianco.
Aroma di mela verde e susina acerba, polvere mista a legno umido, acidula, lievemente lattica.
Man mano che si scalda si fanno sempre più  presenti sentori appartenenti ai Gueuze.
Al palato stesse note aspre ed acide, cosa astringente che ricorda nuovamente polvere e legno umido.
L'aggiunta di zucchero rende molto più "facile" la bevuta.
Corpo medio-leggero, poco carbonata, piacevole.

Faro colore aranciato con scarsa schiuma bianca. Al naso note di mela verde e legno umido che ricordano il sidro. In bocca leggera media con acidità bilanciata dalla dolcezza. Il sapore leggermente fruttato si fonde con un insieme di altri aromi che fanno pensare ad un spumante dolce poco frizzante. Non sono amante dello lambic zuccherato ma devo dire che questo prodotto mi piace ed è beverino come bevanda daperitivo o fine pasto.

Pours hazy amber with almost no head. Aromas of ripe apple, citrus, funk, farmhouse and hay. Taste is ripe apple, green grapes, farmhouse, funk, citrus and minerals. Mouthfeel is tart and dry with medium carbonation and body.

Botella. Marrón semiturbio. No mucha espuma. Aroma asidrado con toques de naranja. Sabor claramente dulce, pero tiene muchos matices. No resulta tan asidrada en boca como se intuía por el aroma, aunque mantiene el toque a manzana verde. Ese toque ácido y dulce hace recordar también a los arándanos. Muy distinta a lo esperado en una cerveza, pero me ha gustado, especialmente después de una comida.

Aroma: Peach, sour, cider, apricot Appearance: Almost no carb, yellow, amber, quickly disappearing foam, light lace Taste: kinda sweet, light sour, little fizz, apricot, cider, light dry sweet sour finish
Ça cest bon. Ça pétille, cest fruité. Ça coule tout seul. Peu de mousse, une couleur foncée et une légèreté toute douce de cerise.
I knew the style; so when I opened lamplolla was a surprise since I expected Lambic, traditional, classic and powerful. For me it is excessively sweet taste makeup of beer, lambic character.

0.375 l bottle with cap and cork from local supermarket. This was probably the first time I opened a bottle of beer with a wine bottle opener. Dark amber, almost brown, colour with a nice tan head. This is obviously somewhat sweet but not too sweet. You can still taste the dry lambic. I think this is quite balanced and the best faro I have tasted so far. If you are going to cure your hangover with a beer, faro woould be a good choice.

0,375l bottle at a tasting - The color is a marmelade-yellowy orange. Aromas of cola and sweet fruits. The flavor has orange marmelade, vanilla, perfumed gummybears and an apple/orange flavor, almost like the swedish soda "trocadero".
375 ml flaske fra Vaaland, Bryne. Disig dyp kobbergyllen kropp med et kortlevd hvitt skum. Friske søte stikkelsbær, sitrus og tretoner. Sursøt smak med fruktsyre og sukker, Medium fylde.

Une robe cuivrée et une mousse qui perdure. Au nez, sucre roux et traits de lambic. Fruits en développement. Au goût, un mélange de notes acides et sucrées assez précis. Retour des notes fruitées et notes boisées. En bouche, corps huileux et bulles plus ou moins agitées. En finale, des notes aigres et douces harmonieuses. Bouteille de 37.5 cl bue avec madame ma femme.

Aroma: horse blanket, hay, vinegar
Taste: medium sour, medium sweet, candy, vinegar
Good beer
Orange, gelb, amber. Säure, Limonade, Orange, Zucker, Aprikose. Erfrischend, rexht süß.

Corked bottle - slightly cloudy light brown, medium carbonation with little head. Funny aroma - not particularly to my nose. Fine fizz in mouth and on tongue. Similar taste to aroma - not my cup of tea - fruity.

Bottle from Anglia Wine Merchants, Ely. Reddish amber, a bit hazy, with a decent-sized cream-coloured head. Lovely scent of kumquat, apricot, cedar. Pleasantly tart without a funky smell. The first sip is surprisingly sweet, almost artificial tasting. The intense sweetness reacts with, rather than balances, the natural tartness. However this dies down a bit over the course of the bottle, leaving an agreeable sweet/sour taste. Refreshing and well-carbonated palate. It is a nice beer but I would have preferred a less sweet version. I guess this style takes some getting used to.

earthy, acidic, vinous, vinegar, Green apples, wheaty, appealing.
Amber colour, small white head.
medium sweetness, lightly bitter, heavily sour, aromatic and layered.
medium body, slick feel, soft carbonation, astringent and long ciderlike finish.
Highly enjoyable.

This is probably the most special beer I have ever tasted. The foam is limited, and the flavor is very difficult to define. It smells a bit of yeast and anything else that I can not completely assess. The taste is only very sweet, but decreases slowly to a slightly sour taste. Finally appears the delicate taste again, and this time I feel that it is perhaps a little apple.

Flaske. Noe uklar ravfarget,moderat karbonert med hvit tynn skumrand. Smaker stikkelsbær,druestein,sitrus,kandissukker,gjær. En meget god faro, men føler kanskje den har en litt kunstig syrlig smak siden den er tilsatt ascorbinsyre ?

Amber color; clear. No head at all.

Candy sugar aroma with a slight sourness.

The flavor is sugary; no sign of the sourness. This is also a full bodied beer with nearly no carbonation. Very much like double bock and less like a lambic. A pretty good beer although it is contrary to the usual taste I like.
Small head. Modest aroma of sweet fruits and sugar. Sour with candy sugar contrast. Maybe some wood.

37,5 cl, flaske, 4,5 % ABV, BB: 02/02/17, købt i Casino i Nice i Sydfrankrig, 13. juli 2015.
Let og knap så tydelig aroma af stikkelsbær og grapefrugt. Måske lidt kælder-aroma fra gærnuancerne og en umiskendelig lugt af noget gammelt og hengemt. 
Mørkerosa Lambic style: Faro med en minimum skumtop, som hurtigt svinder til kant og overflade. 
Første indtryk er en meget sød- og syrlig øl, men også med en vedhæftende bitterhed, der dog spiller en mindre rolle. Sødmen holder ved, omend det syrlige lægger spor på ens tænder. Smagsopsummering: Kraftig sødme, let syrlig og let bitter. 
Middel fyldig krop med en karbonering på et middel niveau. Klæbrig konsistens. Afslutningen er sødlig, let bitter, ganske kort og tør. 
Min - så vidt vides - første Faro, og tvivlen nager: skal det være så sødt? Umiddelbart ikke lige mon kop øl, men det åbner blot interessen for at prøve flere.

Relatively clear amber colour with a medium sized frothy off white head. Aromas of cane sugar, some hay and nut notes develop. Somewhat lively, soft texture, medium body. Pretty sweet and overpowering the subtle acidity, a bit out of balance. Sweet lasting finish.
Color ambra, limpida e con schiuma bianca di minima persistenza. Aroma leggero e appena pungente. Allassaggio acidula, dolce, sapore di mela. Media carbonazione.

Beige, fine head, not persistent. Amber, cloudy. fairly intense and persistent at nose. caramel, raisin, candy sugar, tamarind. Medium carbonation. In the mouth a lot of tamarind. Sour and sweet with a fine bitter in the end. A bit astringent
Un faro tout en rondeur et en équilibre même si le sucre domine un peu, cela reste un plaisir désaltérant.
Bottle; pours amber with a slightly off white head; aroma of dark fruits, brown sugar, and a little vinegar; taste is sweet with brown sugar, dark fruits, and a touch of vinegar; nice beer

Bottle. Hazy amber colour with very small beige foam. Aroma: very fruity and lambicy, funk. Taste has a good combo of sweet and tart flavours, incl. apples, sourness, caramel, hint of wood, a lot of sugar. Low to medium carbonation.

Aparência já ganha pontos na apresentação da garrafa,rótulo simples,porem elegante,bem envasada com rolha e tampa,na taça fluiu líquido âmbar,com bela formação de espuma,alta e duradoura;aroma gostoso,adocicado e cítrico ao mesmo tempo,aparecendo uvas verdes,condimentos,frutas em calda;sabor com bom equilíbrio,início doce com leve azedo no final,boa carbonatação,final ligeiramente ácido e seco,refrescante,média drinkability.

Bottle from Champanes, 
this ale had a clear light to medium amber (red-brown) pour and made a small white and faint off-white head that receded to a ring and large island of a cover, 

it had aromas that were tart and sour fruit that resembled apple, grape and rhubarb, berry with faint cherry, and a faint sweetness in the background, some earth funk, aged and cellar notes, 

the flavors were sour and tart fruit (sour grape and rhubarb) and berry with a lot of sugar sweetness, some wood, very little malt, 
the finish had some sour and tartness with sugary sweetness that sort of kept the drink on the sweet side, 
this beer was much sweeter than I expected, 

the mouth feel was light with average carbonation, 

it was sweet and too sweet to be a thirst quencher on a hot day.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2016 0.375l bottle. pours a hazy amber with a small off-white head and little lacing. aroma of sour cherries, oak, green apples, some rustic farmyard aroma (brett?). sweet and tart fruity flavour, pear lemonade. long sour finish.

Very Amber sugary color. The smell is nicely sourish and smells like brett. The taste is lightly sourish and quite sweet. I still dont like the waste of perfectly good lambic just to add sugar, but I still like it.

Dark orange color with small head. Aroma is lambic funk, apple, berries. Taste is sweet-sour, apples and berries, some caramel, but the Lambic character is still present. An excellent Faro, more of a fruit sweetness than candied sugar, and the tartness is still very present. Still quite sugary. Carbonation is soft. Lecker!

Color ambar brillante, espuma de un par de dedos. Aroma desagradable, aunque a veces recuerda a mortadela (!)... En boca mezcla el sabor de las lambic muy frutal con un dulzor a caramelo, que da un conjunto agridulce, extraño. Supongo que gustará a mucha gente. No es mi caso.

0,25 l bottle from Biervana 
amber, red, clear, minimal head, white foam, cereal, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, oily feel, lively, long finish,
Reddish brown pour sweet smell with some apple tart. Some caramel and sweetness in flavor with very light tartness.
Prevalgono le note dolci, ma se bevuta mentre si mangia un dessert vengono fuori le note acide ed è una vera goduria

250 ml bottle from Seijo Ishi in Shinjuku station. Poured into stemmed half pint glass. Pours a clear amber with a small off-white head. Nice sharp lambic aroma with some muscat and berry. Average to active carbonation with medium to light body. Taste is tart with some sweetness in the background. I like this better than Boons faro. The lambic shines over the candy sugar. Dry and crisp finish that is refreshing and not overly sweet.
Pours copper with a white head. Fruity tart aroma with horse blanket. Very sweet sugar up front with a berry flavor. Tart finish with some funk. Really enjoyed this one. Thanks Maxbier.

On tap at Delirium Cafe in Brussels. Cloudy amber with small white head, poor retention. Aroma of apple vinegar and spices, lemons, yeast, herbs. Taste of a clear lambic, no extremes, tons of sugar, yeast, old hops, apples. Interesting, but too sweet.

Pours amber with a beige head. Aroma is sweet and fruity and isnt very big. Taste has some sweet brown sugars, fruits, apples and some ginger. Palate is very think, but sticks to the taste buds. Overall too sweet for my taste.

Small white head with good retention. Clear reddish dark golden colour. Aroma is sweet cider, apple and caramel. Taste is mostly fruity, both sweet and acid with very slight sour hints. High carbonation and medium body. Nice but quite artificial flavour, in my opinion.
0,15l fles Uitgeschonken amber van kleur. Geur is zoet met appelsap. Smaak is vreemd zoet zuur, als appelsap die te oud Is. Daarna komt er een lichte kots smaak. Nee niet aan mij besteed.

37,5 Sharp lambic aroma. Some oak barrel and lemon acid. Pours clear light ruby red with thin head. Sweet, sugary, acodic, yeasty and bitter at the same time. Totally new combo. Good desert beer. Sour middle and soft sour finish. Numbing. Beautiful lambic. Some apple vinegar in the last sips. BBE 1/7/2016

Aroma: sweet fruits, belgian yeast, light wild notes. Taste: fruits , light wild notes, really sweet but it works great with fruity sourness; very refreshing and drinkable. Fast disappearing head, poor lacing and medium carbonation. Price 25PLN (0,75 bottle)

The beer has a nice brown color with a red tint. The color is a bit pale though. There is hardly any foam. The smell (and taste) have been described by my sister as the smell of feces in a zoo. A bitter penetrant aroma. Nasty. The taste is bad too. A unpleasant bitter sweet and sour taste composition. Disappointing, I had high expectations.
це мій перший ламбік фаро. Незвичн& пиво.Як аромат так і смак нагадал& мені розчинн& фруктов& напій Юппі.
Helder bruin bier met schuim. Smaak is zoetzuur en fruitig met lichte caramel invloed. Redelijk goed bier.

Bottle. Pours dark reddish brown with a white head. Aroma is of malt, funk, fruit, and spice. Taste is sugary sweet, with a distinctive sour tartness as well. All the flavors seem to drop off abruptly in the finish. Very sweet. Mouthfeel is light and sticky. Body is medium and heavily carbonated. Its good, its just not my thing.

Aromaty gumy do żucia, truskawki, ciut stajenki. Smak zdecydowanie owocowy, truskawkowy dżem ze skórką z cytryny, odrobinka alkoholu, takiego "drinkowego" w tle. Wyraźnie zaznaczony brązowy cukier - i jest on jedyną rzeczą, która zostaje w posmaku po wypiciu łyka. Jest trochę kwaśności, ale bardzo szybko się ulatnia. Gdzieś tam pobrzmiewa jeszcze drewienko i guma balonowa. Dla miłośników cukierków z bąbelkami - mus. Dla lubiących kwachy (nawet to z dodatkiem cukru) - niekoniecznie. Ale nie jest najgorzej. PS: Uwaga - po ogrzaniu coś, jakby mikro-goryczka!

Aroma: dry cider, mold, apple, acidic. Appearance: amber, clear, minimal head, white foam. Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, heavily sour. Palate: light body, thin feel, oily feel, fizzy, abrupt finish, slightly astringent.

Bottle. Clear, caramel brown color, small head. Nice aroma, caramel, spices, banana. Interesting taste, sweet, sour, very low bitterness. Medium texture, nice fresh carbonation. Malty, sweet caramel aftertaste

Copper/amber with thin tan head. Funk, hay and rotting fruit in the aroma. Flavor is sugary sweet, followed by barn funk. This style is quite sweet, in moderation and for the right occasion it is nice.
Copper look. Lovely sweet. Fruity. Earthy. Champagne like. A hint of sourness. A sweet sweet lambic. Fancy, but jovial and lush. Love it!
Sweet and sour. A little funk, brown sugar, and even a faint strawberry taste. I like it.

Keg at Ox184. Pours clear brown, no head. Nose is sweet and sour, brown sugar, dried fruits. Taste is also sweet and sour,actually really sweet, but tasty. Very tart as well. Brown sugar. In a way its very straightforward but I like how its both very sour and very sweet.
Light bretty, caramel sugary malts... some berries... veeeery sweet... lacks sour notes... ok
Excellente lambic....un peu acide sur la fin, mais agréable. Ne pas boire trop fraîche.
Gylden brun klar med lavt hvitt skum. Lukter bæreddik og lett trevirke. Sukkersøt smak, bær og eplesødme, tydelig syrlighet. Syrligheten sitter lenge. Noe stikky
Klar rødbrun farge med noe skum rundt glasskanten.Lukter sure bær, eple og litt gjær.Smaker veldig eple og mye sødme. God syrlig avslutning. Kjenner også fruktsmaken lenge.

The most interesting beer among popular Belgian, available on sale worldwide

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(bottle) hazy deep golden-amber colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of bretty funk, caramel and melted butter, heavy vanilla, some cherry stones, oily fries and earth. flavour is rather sweet and tart, with some rather prominent bretty funk, more vanilla, earth and apricots. medium-bodied with average carbonation. surprisingly good.

Draft at The Flying Saucer in San Antonio. The aroma is incredibly sweet with a boatload of sugar, a touch of raspberry, heavy green apple, pungent alfalfa, and a bit of yeasty barnyard funk. Pours deep caramel with a thick and fizzy head. Not surprisingly, the taste is also quite sweet (but not cloying) with candi sugar, honey, a light cherry tone, some golden raisin, slight vinegar, and a minor grassy note at the finish. It reminds be vaguely of drinking some apple vinegar with a ton of sugar in it. Light and refreshing body with a minor puckering texture. From previous experience with Lindemans, I didnt expect much from this beer, but its drinkability was a nice surprise, though I find it too touch to enjoy on a regular basis.

2015/04/22 - Pours a dirty amber-brown colour with an off white head that quickly vanishes without lacing. Aroma is sweet; sugar, honey, apples, hay , dark fruits, barnyard, Brett and a touch of vinegar. Taste is predominantly sweet with a mildly sour finish; apples, hay barnyard, vinegar, cherry, honey, sugar and hints of wood. Mouthfeel is a touch syrupy, with average carbonation and a sweet, acidic and mildly tart finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Review based on the BJCP2208 guidelines (style 17D/17E, adapted). Bottle 25 cl - Batch GA220FA021454. AROMA: complex brett aromas with notes of goat, horse and barnyard, balanced with a moderate sour/acidic aroma. no hop aromas. APPEARANCE: dark gold color (dark orange) and slightly hazy, with a thin ivory head with poor retention (lambic). TASTE: very sweet flavour that masks the brett characteristics, giving them only a faint character. bitterness absent with a sweet finish. PALATE: medium-low body with medium-low carbnation. OVERALL: a faro-style lambic wich is very sweet and can be a good entry point to the lambic/gueuze world.

Très mauvaise semaine de mon côté avec les produits Lindemans; après la pomme que jai détestée au plus haut point, la Faro. Cette dernière partait cependant du bon pied: joli look, nez bien acidulé duquel némanent aucune odeurs artificielles ou saturées. Non le nez est bien construit présentant les aspects propres au style lambic: petits fruits rouges et vifs, vapeurs acétiques, champignons, terre mouillée. Cette bière aurait été très agréable si ce ne fut de la quantité invraisemblable de sucre dont les brasseurs lont pourvue. Limpression que jen retire est que ceux-ci ont voulu rendre le style accessible à tous en sucrant ce produit de manière artificielle et démesurée mais lont rendu ainsi difficile à déguster sans un verre deau à proximité tellement la bière est sen trouve alourdie. Tout cela est bien dommage.
