Pink amber hue with no head. Nose is composed of sweet caramel, sweet fruity notes and a tiny bit rubbery. Flavour is honey like with sweet fruits, slightest tartness and wood. First faro for me, not really an instant favorite, but alright. Too sweet for me.

0.375 bottle. Hazy, dark amber color and a small, white head. Sweet and sour fruity aroma with hints of candy and some unfortunate metal. Taste is really sweet: candy, fruits, honey, sugar, sour fruits as well. Medium body, slick texture, and lively carbonation. Finish is also sweet and very fruity. Overall this is my first faro, and although I do not have a developed taste for it I certainly enjoyed this one.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2015 Pours golden opaque colour with creamy white head. Visually high carbonation.
Aroma without notice of an alcohol, aroma of grape, winegar, chardonnay...similar is taste. Malt sweetness is low, hop bitterness medium, f inish is dry sour.
Bottle. Brown-amber color. Wild aroma: sour, wet skin, hay, barnyard, a little fruit. Sweet sugar and sour lambic taste.
Cerveza de sabor muy dulce. Color pardo. Perfecta para tomar despues de las comidas.

25 cl. bottle poured in to a Flute. Hazy, copper colour with a golden hue. Fluffy, white head. Slightly tart aroma with dusty hops, light barnyard, candid sugar, wooden notes, tart fruits - apples. Taste is lightly sour. Medium body with a creamy texture and a lively carbonation. Finishes dry and lightly sour - well balanced with candid sugar/acidic notes. Nice Faro Lambic - a good start in to the world of Lambics.
Bottle bought in Belgium,. Copper colored. Aroma of belgian yeast. Sweet taste with a bit of sourness, a hint of bitterness. Fuity, almost like a cider.
3 oz pour at good temp from a tap. Beautiful appearance. Raspberry and lime. Nose is very yeasty.

Bottle from The Beer Store Wilson. Medium brown hue, murky clarity with mostly diminishing white fizzy head. No lacing. Sweet light fruit, grapes, cherry and some light spice aromas. Sweet bitter dark fruit (prune) up front with more of a dry licorice (after the first taste) and sour fruit (rest of the experience) finish. Light carbonation on the palate. I would drink it again.

Hazy brown body, minimal white head. Totally weak smell of lemongrass. Starts off very sour, an intense taste of brown sugar follows. Medium body with fizzy carbonation.  It kind of tastes more like a fresh lemonade than like a beer, but still: delicious stuff.

Poured a dark amber colour with a thin head. Aroma is of sweet sugars, note of cranberry and sour yeast. Flavor is an astringent sour mixed with lemon, cranberries and brown sugar. Sweet and sour mix is well balanced. Medium bodied with light carbonation leading to a sweet finish.
Pours dark red.color like ruby. The aroma is sweet, candy yeast. The flavor.is very fruity and sweet, very good.
The bottle looks very festive and it is big, and thats good because the beer is very good as well!

375ml bottle at home. Hazy amber brown with a medium white soapy head. Medium body with lively carbonation. Well balanced sweet and sour tones. Caramel, fruits, citrus, lemon, grapes and vinegar. A tasty sour brew.

Aromat: charakterystyczny dla piw kwaśnych z przysłowiową końską derką i lekką stęchlizną na czele. Sporo estrów (głównie wiśnie), nieco słodyczy i odrobina zleżałego chmielu.

Barwa: pomarańczowa w kierunku czerwonej, klarowna. Piana biała, lekko zabarwiona, początkowo obfita, ale niemal natychmiast opadająca do cienkiej obwódki przy ściankach.

Smak: wyraźna kwaskowość, niemal wykręcająca język, jednak dość szybko kontrowana sporą dawką słodyczy pochodzącą z kandyzowanego cukru. Do tego nieco drewnianych nut beczkowych. Średnia pełnia, niskie nagazowanie, cierpkie odczucie w ustach i lekki alkohol na finiszu. Klasyka.

Bottle at home. Pours a brownish amber with no real head. Aroma is sweet fruit and lemons with some slight funk. Flavor is strange, tastes like someone took a half empty jar of strawberry jam and filled it up with vodka and then squeezed a lemon into it. Thats it. Very sweet and sticky mouthfeel. After almost 2300 beers this is my first Faro and Im not sure what to think. Drinkable, but I wouldnt seek this out. Need to try others for comparison.

On tap at Poechenellekelder, Brussels.
Light celery and sour brown sugar aroma with faint banana. Hazy bronze under a lasting, bubbly off-white. Sweet and sour flavour with balance toward sweet. Caramel candy flavour with faint pickle juice and green apple. Very low, woody bitterness. Medium body, very low carbonation, smooth yet with a little mouth pucker.

bottle from trade with bartlebier, thanks Frank. copper color, hazy, small white head. smells sour, fruity, pears, cherries, light funk. medium to full body, quite sweet, honey, some fruit notes, some berries, grapes, light sourness thats hidden under all the sweetness, overall a bit sweet ciderish taste. sweet light fruity finish. quite heavy sweet for the 4.5% ABV. decent, a bit too sweet for me.
Keg at spitfire. Pours hazy orange, nose is funky, fruity, taste is similar, sweet and tasty.

Weer eens wat anders. Wel een interessante combinatie van zuur en zoet. Vrijwel geen schuim, amberkleurig. Licht zure nasmaak. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is nice, fruity, winy. Taste is sweet. Intense sweet. Nice wine caracters and grape and melasa. Again same problem as the lindemans framboise. Its made with acesulfame K which is dangeerous sweetener. Why you dont use sugar lindemans!!!

Piana drobna, bardzo krótkotrwa?a. Po kilkunastu sekundach prawie ca?kowicie zredukowana, na ?rodku szk?a pozosta?a niewielka ilo?? p?cherzyków.
Zapach bardzo wytrawny, winogrona, wi?nie, cukier, minimalnie owoce kandyzowane, nuty kwiatowe ale i odrobina wilgotnego kurzu i ciemna jakby troch? przejrza?a cytryna. 
Nasycenie wi?cej ni? ?rednie, mi?o ?askocze w j?zyk. Smak Faro jest niesamowity, lekka herbata z cytryn?, winogrona, kwa?ne wi?nie w s?odkiej zalewie, czere?nie, maliny, nadpsute, wodniste - kompotowe truskawki. Jest te? cukier kandyzowany, delikatnie przypalony. Ka?dy ?yk przynosi lekk? pestkow? goryczk?, a w finiszu jest mocno wytrawny, kwaskowy bardzo pobudzaj?cy kubki smakowe i ?linianki. Alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty. Faktura g?adka, a nawet aksamitna, super.
W Faro mo?na si? albo zakocha?, albo je znienawidzi?. Ja polecam z ca?ego serca.

Aromat półsłodkiego białego wina i beczkowe tło. Barwa miedziana, zamglone. Piękna drobna i zbita, choć krótka piana. W smaku słodkie białe wino, posmak dobrych drożdży, w tle czerwona porzeczka, trochę zielonych jabłek, suszonych moreli. Świetne wrażenie w ustach i długi, owocowy finisz.

Bottle from mchughs. Pours light red with no head. Aroma is candy floss, sour apple, hints of vinegar. Flavour is sweet caramel sugar with a sour apple aftertaste. Toffee apple. Needs more sour, style is very sweet. Not mad on this style.

Wąchając piwo z butelki trudno nie odnieść wrażenia, że mamy do czynienia z białym winem. Kolor w moim szkle przy dnie jest złoty, a wyżej jasno-bursztynowy, ale w każdym innym pokalu będzie już zdecydowanie bursztynowy. Piana dosyć luźna, kremowa, bardzo szybko opada do ledwo widocznej. W aromacie ze szkła jest białe wino, są wyraźne nuty dzikie  końska derka, te klimaty, Jest trochę palonego cukru, jest ledwo wyczuwalny zwietrzały chmiel. Dobra  pierwszy łyk  jest przyjemnie kwaśne, jest bardzo owocowe  czerwone jabłko, winogrona, agrest. Po chwili wyraźna staje się słodycz w takim karmelowym, kandyzowanym typie, która to już pozostaje na języku na dłużej. Wysycenie jest dosyć wysokie i przywodzi na myśl to znane z szampana. Ze względu na całą masę smaków i zapachów absorbujących sensorykę to piwo jest umiarkowanie pijalne, co jest jednak zaletą, gdyż pozwala cieszyć się dłużej jego degustacją.

Aroma: Faint hints of burnt sugar.
Appearance: Clear pale copper color with no head.
Taste: Light sweetness with hints of sourness.
Palate: Medium body, thick texture, soft carbonation, long finish.
Overall: A nice balance between sweet and sour. Really well done.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lovely clear orange amber with off-white head that reduces quickly, like most lambics, but leaves decorative skim and lacing.
Nose is pickles and peppers, or perhaps pickled pepper, but the palate is more like cherries or strawberries sitting in vinegar. Theres considerable funk, especially initially, but also underlying sugar. The combination of sweetness and sourness is pronounced and enjoyable.
Faro clearly isnt for everyone, but it does offer a nice excursion into slightly wilder territory than most lambics.

Piwo wysokiej klasy! Wyraźnie dzikie, winne ale jednocześnie słodkie. Dodatek cukry kandyzowanego robi swoje. Piwo wybitnie degustacyjne, do sączenia. Jak to bywa z belgijskimi piwami - ciężko je opisać. Zdecydowanie wyjątkowe piwne przeżycie. Polecam nie tylko fanom piwnej dziczyzny

WYGLĄD: Barwa bursztynowa, opalizujące. Piana drobna i średnio pęcherzykowa, niska.
AROMAT: Dużo owoców (suszone morele, wiśnie w likierze, rodzynki, czarna porzeczka, aronia), lekka "końska derka/siodło", nuty winne.
SMAK: Zaskakująco słodki, ale jest też kontra goryczkowa (pozostająca na języku). Generalnie owoce takie jak w zapachu.
OGÓLNIE: Najsłodsza wersja Lambic-a jakiego miałem okazję degustować, ale z pewnością jest to zasługa cukru kandyzowanego.
Кисло-ка винный вкус. Легкие нотки шоколад&

Aroma: Medium, Fruity, cherries. Medium-light Barnyard, 
Appearance: Brilliant, amber body. Initial medium, off-white head. Head quickly dies away.
Flavour: Medium cherries, crisp. Medium-light acidity. Medium-light sweetness. Low barnyard. Very dry finish with lingering cherries.
Mouthfeel: Medium body, medium-high carbonation. Slick mouth covering.
Overall: Very good beer! Highly recommended.

375 ml bottle, poured. 
17E. Gueuze

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 Pours a deep brown reddish colour with a small, quickly disappearing head which is typical for a lambic. Aroma is fruity (cherry, apple) with a whiff of candy sugar and some funk. The taste is moderately sweet with quite a hefty pack of sourness which doesnt intend to overstay its welcome. Fizzy, the carbonation is really strong. Overall impression of light fizzy wine or champagne. So easy drinking, enjoyable.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2016 Bernsteinfarben mit wenig weißem Schaum. Säuerlich Leipziger Duft. Im Antrunk zunächst klebrig süß, dann deutlich sauer und malzig mit Aromen von saurem Apfel. Kein Bier für jede Gelegenheit, aber gut.
 8	/	8	/	7	/	7	/	6	/	8	/	3	/	6	/	75

Bottle of 37.5cl, in a Tumbler glass; from the fridge.

A beautiful clear-brown colour, with a nice aroma of lambiek
Nice taste of faro lambiek (sucre candy and vinegar), but maybe a little too sweet.

Try it.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2016 Appearance: brown clear liquid with light yellow frothy head. Aroma: earthy cidery. Taste: semi sweet, heavy sour. Like kosmos marmelade. Palate: light body, thin feel, soft carbonation, long finish,
Pours a ruby red with zero head. Aroma of brandy, vinegar and blueberries. Very sweet with hints of cherry and quite a strong acidity to it. Not my style of beer at all.

Lots of cherries that are nice. Great taste. Best late evening. Wonderful mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep reddish brown color with a small, off white head that leaves lacing on the way down. Smell is sweet, raisin, caramel, candied cherry. Really sweet all the way through. Candy sugar, port, grape soda, light barrel notes. Medium to heavy with medium low carbonation. Really interesting brew but definitely not my style.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2015 Bottle. Amber tea-like color with small head. Aroma of champagne, apple. Taste is sweet with nice heavy sourish notes. Aftertaste is sweet, with notes of dry fruits. Interesting beer!
37,5 cl bottle. Hazy amber with small head that doesnt last long. Aroma is fruity, caramel, almost champagne like. Lightly acidic, with a kick of funky sweet aftertaste.
Pierwszy pity lambic. Aromat winny, poza tym wyczuwalne jabłka. W smaku kwaskowość kontra słodycz od karmelu. Widoczny wpływ karmelu na barwę piwa.
Sweet Faro, nice ripe fruits, caramel and light acidity, not sour at all. Leaves a delicate cherry finish.
W aromacie nuty szampańskie, winne, W smaku kwaskowe, niskie wysycenie.
Great beer. Very sweet caramel flavor, strong carbonation. Then comes acid and good aftertaste.

Bottle 0.25 l, Carrefour, Wrocław, Poland.
Ciemnobursztynowe, mętnawe piwo o obfitej ale szybko opadającej pianie i świeżym aromacie słodko-kwaśnych jabłek. W smaku rześkie i orzeźwiające, początkowo słodkawe, jabłkowe a następnie lekko kwaskowe.

25cl Bottle. Clear, brownish with a small white head leaving minor lacing. Aroma: of fermented fruits, some acidic lambic scents, some sherry like tones.
Taste: Sour but countered by a applejuice meets sherry. sweetness. Dry aftertaste.
medium-full body, average carbonation.
Not my style, but well made.
A great beer, even though I prefer my lambics sour. Full of raspberries on the nose and flavour.

ASPETTO: ambrato, pelo di volpe, limpido, con schiuma bianca, abbastanza scarsa e poco persistente, con bollicine abbastanza fini. AROMA: pungente e penetrante, stimola tantissimo lappetito. Acidulo di frutti rossi acidi, con le classiche note di putrefazione tipiche dei lambic (sebbene non così forti come i lambic originali). GUSTO: si ripresentano i sentori avvertiti al naso. Sapore pieno e deciso, stimola la lingua che è un piacere. Appena messa in bocca si avverte soprattutto un dolciastro di frutti rossi, per poi lasciar subito spazio ad un acidulo non invadente. Retrugusto abbastanza persistente. Carbonizzazione che si sente, corpo leggero. CONCLUSIONE: birra di un agrodolce fenomenale, molto saporita, che stimola lappetito, dal sapore che si fa ricordare. E ve lo dice uno che non ama le birre acide!

In bottiglia. Colore ramato chiaro, schiuma fine e abb abbodante. aroma di ciliegia, frutti rossi e zucchero candito. Al palato corpo leggero con sentori di legno, ciliegia, mirtillo, finale secco e dolce

37.5cl bottle. Pours cleasr dasrk amber with ad minimal off white head. Aroma is lemon, caramel, yeast, funkiness. Taste is similar starting with a very clean lambic sourness followed by the sweet kick from tyhe added candied sugar. Medium body, lively carbonation watery mouthfeel.
Clear amber pour, white head. Aromas of candi sugar, and barnyard funk. Flavour is the same, on the sweet side. Okay.
Ambrée, très pétillante, mousse blanche retombant très vite. Nez de sucre, bois, vinaigre. Bouche aigre-douce : sucre, caramel, vin. Vraiment pas mon truc : trop sucrée, trop "limonade".

Bottle. Clear, red tea with a very fresh white head leaving a pleasant lacing. Aroma of fermented fruits, mostly cherry and berries, plus some acidic lambic scents. Taste is sour countered by sweets countered again by sourness that lasts into dry aftertaste. Very enjoyable. If one wants to have fun with sweety beer, that?s the well-balanced example.
Smells like a lambic or gueze, and looks the same. However, the addition of too much candy sugar makes it too sweet for my taste. Little disappointed...
Bottle. Caramel and garnet with no head. Sweet vinegar and fruits. Sweet apples and berries and a tart finish.
bottle. clear amber color with small head. aroma is fruity (mostly red fruits) with acidic notes. taste is sweet with funky hints at the end.
0,375l Flasche. Tiefgoldenes Bier. Riecht nach vergorenen Äpfeln. Schmeckt erst etwas säuerlich, dann kommt eine angenehme Fruchtnote. Süffig!

It pours a light amber with a good deal of off white head. It has a sweet and sour smell with a fair amount of yeast present. The sweet sugar taste is bold with a sour tart finish. There are yeast and malts present, but the sweetness of the sugar is dominant.

0,375l Rasty hazy orange, white thin head. Aroma is caramel, some sourness, fruits, sweets, apricose. Taste is fruity sweet at th beginning. Ends with quite storng sourness.Slight dryness. Medium body. Sparkling mouthfeel.

Aroma is a bit like crap. I can feel sour caramel. Rusty colour. Taste is the better part. It tastes nicely sour with nice caramel taste. Taste doesnt have much to do with smell. It has a lot foam in the beginning,but it disappears quite fast.

Pours a slightly hazy medium amber with a slight garnet hue. Excellent head, lacing and retention. The nose is a light white wine like sweetness with grape and berry notes. Light medium body with a touch of creamy texture. Normal carbonation with some effervescence in the middle and finish. The World Class flavor profile hits the perfect balance of sweet and sour, excellent intensity and reasonable complexity. It begins with a blend of tart sweet fruit. As the tartness fades, brown candi sugar becomes evident. The middle produces a light sourness that is sour fruit in nature rather than vinegar. The finish is a slow fade of sweet/sour tartness. This one is an excellent choice for lambic introduction.
Reddish gold pour with a thin off white head. Lots of berries on the nose, taste is red berries, a little sourness, a fair bit of sweetness. Not bad at all.

Bottle to glass. Pours a mostly clear amber ruby color with a light tan head. Aroma is mostly sweet berries, very mild tartness. Flavor has a big sweetness, touch of sour berries, but not much. Light to medium in body with a long lingering sweetness. Tasty. Quite sweet.

On tap at Belmont Station.

A: Semi-clear brownish red color. Lazy white head. Some lacing.

N: Cherry, vinegar, sugar, and honey. Hint of raspberry. Acetic acid and a note of toffee.

T:Very, very sweet. Lightly tart. 

M: Light body, sticky a bit, alcohol is muted, carbonation is moderate. 

O: big sweet beer, as one would expect. I kind of wonder how its different than their regular Lambics, however, particularly the Kriek.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2015 Bottle @ home. Pours with a dark orange colour, medium sized rocky long lasting white head. Aroma has hints of leather, barnyard and basement aromas, quite strong. Taste is medium to heavy sweet, light to medium sour, absolutely stunning; great! Medium to full body, creamy texture, average carbonation, great mouthfeel. Fantastic brew!
birra da accompagnare con dolci o aperitivi...leggera e perfetta per le ragazze che non amano il sapore della "vera" birra! birra con note vinose dolci! Perfetta per determinanti situazioni.
Je ne connais pas trop le style faro...Là, cest infâme, dégueu, écoeurant, de la bière limonade fruitée immonde. Bu quelques gorgées tant bien que mal, jeté le reste, au 03/02/2014.

Douce bière sucrée, généralement for apprécié des palais sucrés ou de ceux qui "naiment pas la bière".
Un goût fruité subtil, une bière au goût peu alcoolisé.
Une robe plus sombre que ce que lon pourrait attendre, mais un goût unique.

Darker than I expected. Amber color, expected lighter. Aroma of lactic sour and slight sugary sweetness. Taste is lactic sour with a sugary sweetness and almost some oaky woody flavors. Almost tastes like wet wood though, think that is the sugar with the lambic. Odd style. I like the geuze or fruit lambic better. Low carbonation. Sour is maybe 3 of 10 sour. And too sweet, maybe not even as sweet as some fruit lambics, but sugary sweet is weird. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours russet red with a nice thin white head. Sweet sassafras on the nose, and a sweet tart rootbeer flavor on the palate. Overall, a nice appertif, but too sweet for me.

Piana nieco oblepia szkło pozostawiając lekki korzuszek. w aromacie głównie nuty szampańsko winne, orzeźwiająco kwaskowe. w smaku, nieco kojarzący się z cydrem co ponoć jest wadą, jednak dla mnie bardzo przyjemne kwaskowe lekko nagazowane. goryczki praktycznie brak. barwa miedziana klarowna

Bottle. Medium head, clear red.
Aroma: Horse, candy sugar, fruits. Very intense. 
Taste: Medium sweet and medium sour, good balance. Flavor of fruits, citrus, sweets.
Good drinkability, nice refreshments but after a while it becomes too sweet.
Classical belgian beer, every beer geek should try it!
Brassy, clear. First taste very sweet, then a slight bitterness. Pear and apple flavor, light aftertaste of rhubarb.
Fles30cl. Kleur bruin roode gloed. Witte schuimkraag. Weinig schuim. Geur zoet fruit. Smaak zoet fruitig appelachtig. Eindigend in wrang zuur.

Robe cuivrée, limpide.
Premier goût très doux, puis arrive une légère aigreur.
Saveur de pomme et poire en majorité, léger arrière goût de rhubarbe. La gazéification est plutôt importante.
Une bonne bière lambic, rafraîchissante.

0,25 l bottle from P & M Getränke in Bonn. Clear, amber liquid with quickly diminishing white head. Sourish aroma of fermented apples, white sparkling wine, lemon and rhubarb. Taste is of fermented apples, white sparkling wine, hot wine punch, lemon, rhubarb and candy sugar. It begins rather sweet and ends with a tart, sour finish. Well balanced. Medium body, average carbonation, sparkling mouthfeel. Overall really nice and refreshing.
Flaska bishops Gustav - frisk fruktig arom. Kristallklar! Lätt att dricka fruktig smak nästan lite som ett vin.
12oz bottle to tulip. Moderate funk aroma. Amber brown. Free of sediment. This is quite similar to a sweet champagne but with a slightly funky finish.

250 ml bottle from supermarket.
Dark amber to brown, moderate hazy body, with a tiny, frothy, white head.
Aroma of yeast, barnyard, sour fruits, earth, sugar.
Taste is very sweet, sugary, with sour fruits, earth, barnyard and a slight dryness from the background, merging into some salty effect.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes sweet, salty, fruity and a bit dry.

Good. The strong sweetness and the moderate, dry sourness combined lead to a salty impression, which is quite interesting. Otherwise not a beer I would often drink, the sugar is just too dominant for my liking and also disturbs the drinkability in my opinion.
Pours brown, with very short, white head. Highly carbonated, with medium body. Aroma of yeast, malts, some skin/horse notes, sweet. Taste is 50/50 sweet/sour. Fun to drink, not bad at all
Cervesa de color coure i escuma color ivori. Aromes i sabors dolços que recorden al sucre, caramel, també canyella i suc de poma.

Dark amber beer with very small white head. Sweet rock sugar aroma. Very sweet oily siropy flavour. (Bottle 25cl)Earlier Rating: 11/12/2014 Total Score: 2.7Dark amber beer with very small white head. Sweet rock sugar aroma. Very sweet oily siropy flavour. (Bottle 25cl)

Drunk from 25cl bottle bought from Delhaize, Belgium. Overly sweet for my taste but enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours slightly translucent rose/brown with a thin off white head, very small, champagne type bubbles, very attractive. Nose is earthy, yeasty, cheese, leather, a little horsey. Rather sweet, chalky mouthfeel, there is a sourness towards the back but not overwhelming. I love it.
Small 25 cl bottle from Dranken Geers. Dirty bronze pour with a light head. Soda like, sweet sugary, some light bitterness and some very light tartness.

Schuim zakt snel, zalige Faro maar voor mij iets te zoet.
Ruim pallet aan smaken, een uniek bier voor de liefhebber.

25 cl bottle from Wine of Galilee in Tallinn (below  2). Pours a deep golden colour with lots of thin sediment floating, and an off-white head that drops fast to leave a small island of film, then disappears. Nose is sweeeet! And also sour. Surprisingly, I find it quite non-offending, considering it reminds me of cherry yoghurt and caramel candies which Im not a very big fan of. Behind that theres some familiar dry dustiness. Very thick palate with a cidery dry mouthfeel, carbonation mediumish or below. Sugary sweet taste with very ripe yellow autumn fruits, with considerable white wine notes. I expected it to have more acidity, but that seems to be buried in the sweetness. This was my first Faro - I quite liked it! Not sure if Id have survived a bigger bottle though!

Bottle. Clear red. Aroma is sweet strawberry and raspberry jelly. The taste follows and adds a hint of chocolate and more sugary sweetness. Very low carb with a thin mouthfeel. Overall, not my favorite style.
Bottle. Clear copper/red with no head. Aroma is cherry syrup, oak and a little mint. Taste follows pretty closely. Medium sticky mouthfeel. Weird but not terrible.

Piwo pieknie zapakowane, w aromacie za dużo końskiej derki, zwłaszcza po lekkim ogrzaniu się, smak - spora kwaśność octowo-winno-wiśniowa, lekka pestkowa goryczka i słodkość rodzynkowa (od kandyzowanego cukru). Niestety w smaku także wyczuwalna stajnia i za dużo octu winnego.

Awesome lambic. Smells straight up of cherries, tart and delicious. Tastes are more of the same. Sweet, tart and fruity. Everything I expect from this style and it does not disappoint. Medium bodied with a lingering tartness.

0,375l. Pours copper with a frothy beige head. Good lacing. Aroma of apples and champagne. Tastes like Russian champagne with added bitterness and sugar.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 37,5cl late at night. Gelly diminishing layer. Brown light amber color. Aroma is apples, wood, cherries, sour mix. Taste is wine, sour, top candy.

Lindemans Faro is the most candy-like of all the Lambics Ive tried. Aroma is pretty straightforward - fruity and yeasty. Carbonation is lively and the head is fizzy. Taste was somewhat tart and very fruity (as youd expect). A combination of white wine and apple juice is the best way I can describe the flavor. Despite the low ABV, Lindemans Faro has a dryness and consistency which remind me of champagne. Overall, this is a great introduction to the Faro style. Not to funky and not too sour, its a surprisingly approachable beer.

Bottle.

A- White wine, grapes, subtle funk, sour, musty.

A- Amber color, clear liquid, off white head.

T- White wine, grapes, green apple, subtle funk, slightly sour, sweet, tart.

P- Medium body, average texture, high carbonation, dry fruity finish.

O- A good intro into beer for wine lovers. Tasted like a white wine with a nice crisp and dry finish. Not overly sour or sweet and just the right amount of fruitiness.

25cl bottle from Tasty Life, Xiamen. Pours orange brown with a minimal head which soon disappears. Can get the typical lambic aroma but a lot sweeter to taste. Not overpoweringly sweet though. Maybe good as an introduction to gueuze.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2017 Barwa ciemnego, zmętnionego bursztynu, piana niewysoka, ale ładnie zdobiąca szkło. Aromat kwaśnych jabłek, brzoskwiń, szampana, w tle odrobina dzikich drożdży.
W smaku owocowa kwaśność, sporo nut jabłkowych, przełamana karmelem (może nawet zbyt zaznaczonym), na końcu minimalna, ale bardzo przyjemna goryczka. Wysycenie powyżej przeciętnego.
Świetny trunek, lekki, orzeźwiający.
Bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Pours bronz almost no head. Aroma of dry apple cider, yeast. Taste med sour, med sweet, apple, hints of orange, dry, acidity, some spiceness. Good one.

750ml corked bottle served in a Lambic flute glass.
A: Pours a clear dark orange color forming a huge, fizzy and soapy white to yellow head. Great retention and lots of lingering and soapy lacings left in the glass
S: Classic Lambic: Very fruity with strong notes of Lambic yeasts. Strong notes of Apple juice. Mild Citric and vinegar in the nose
T: Sweet upfront. Strong notes of fruits, mainly apples, tastes a bit like a cider. Some caramel malts. In overall, a sweet taste. Mild sourness
M: Very light body and strong carbonation. Sweet fruity aftertaste
O: Good drinkability. Refreshing beer. A little bit too sweet
[ BA Review @ 6/28/2010 ]
A nice mix of sweet and sour. The aroma is that of a lambic but the taste is a nice blend of sourness and sweetness. Not something I could drink all night but a nice change.

Transfer from BA review on 1-12-14-

 Served on tap in a chalice glass

 Appearance  The beer is served a deep brownish cherry red color with a red tinted head. Upon serving there is a lighter tinted, almost cream, colored head floating atop the brew. The small head fades over about a 3 minute time frame leaving some light bits of foamy lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma was most potent of some aromas of a Belgian candied sugar and some darker fruits of cherry and raisin. Some more funky aromas were there as well, consisting of a hay like and grassy smells along with a old leathery and somewhat grainy and barnyard like smell, which when mixed with the sugar and fruit smells produced a rather weird smell overall.

 Taste  The taste begins with a sweet flavor with tons of Belgian candied sugar flavors and a little bit of a darker fruit taste. A lighter grainy taste as well as some sourness is present upfront both of which grow slightly stronger throughout the taste. While some sourness comes to the tongue, it remains relatively light, being largely overshadowed by the sweeter flavors. A little bit of a hay like taste and a bit of a funky and lactic acid taste also come to the tongue more toward the middle and the end. The mix of flavors that finishes up the taste ends up leaving a rather sugary sweet, but lightly sour and funked flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the medium side in terms of thickness and creaminess with a carbonation level that is on the higher side. While the higher carbonation was fantastic for the sweet and sour flavors of the brew, a slightly thinner body may have been more appropriate for the sweeter and sour nature of the beers flavor. Even said though, the feel overall was still rather appropriate.

 Overall  Sweet and sugary with a lighter level of funk and sour. If looking for a sweeter and more sourbrew then this is a good go to, but for me it was a little too sugary to likely want on much occasion.
Brown, clear, with white towards yellow foam. Mild sour, caramel,dust and hay in the aroma. Sour, sweet, toffee bonbon, with a hint of fruit. Sweet sour raisin aftertaste, rally nice

Bière faro de 4,5 % abv, dune brasserie fondée en 1822 et membre des Belgian Family Brewers.
Malt dorge et de froment, candi et un édulcorant supplémentaire.
Le faro est une vieille bière régionale qui a eu son heure de gloire à la belle époque.
Couleur ambre foncé. Clarté nette. Bulles grosses par dizaines partout.
Mousse beige clair en nappage crémeux à 1mm.
Arômes de lambic, cerise noire, pointe de cassis et myrtille.
1ère bouche très douce sur une marmelade de fruits noirs et rouges, avec un fond aigre doux.
Arrière-bouche sucrée au candi, et des accents de malt et de fût.
2ème sur le fruit sucré et le malt caramel. Des parfums de chai un peu distants
et de premier niveau.
3ème sur des fruits confits, de la pâte de fruits, nuances de dattes fugaces.
La longueur est doucereuse, un peu mielleuse. Des relents de lambic, mais beaucoup de candi et sucre.
Lalcool est doux, il suit quasiment en spectateur ce breuvage !!
La finale ne ferait pas de mal à une mouche...
CONCLUSION : le faro est un genre ancien qui mérite que lon sy arrête, mais certainement pas que lon sy attarde... parce quil manque grandement de complexité.
Bottle from Giant Eagle in Pittsburgh. Somewhat sweeter than most lambocs. Plenty of bitterness and an arid mouth feel. My wife loved it!

375ml bottle. Pours copper with a frothy beige head. Good lacing. Aroma of apples and champagne. Tastes like Russian champagne with added bitterness and sugar Don't think I could drink more two in a row.

"HA! Style #73!! I really havent gone out of my way to get this, but it was on the shelf in Seattle staring me down. I thought itd be a lot like the Geuezes, which i didnt really like, but i dug this one. the aroma is more tart and funky than the flavor, but the candi sugar in the flavor was pretty cool too. nice sweet aftertaste."

Amber brown beer, small white head. Smells like a lambic with sugary notes, fruit tartness. Flavor is yeast notes, sugary sweetness, tartness. Lively carbonation. Pretty easily drinkable, but pretty boring, no real depth to it.
Foam had disappeared into nothingness before I could take a good look at it. A lot of added sugar. This would be the beer that could give to some soda addict that wants to discover lambic.

Clear amber body with a thin white head. Aroma is malty, caramel, some citrus fruit, some apple. Taste is heavy sweet with medium to light sourness. Body is light to medium. Sticky texture, soft carbonation.
Tuoksu hiivainen, makea, omenaa. Vaahto katoava, nauhamainen. Samea. Maku siiderimäinen, makea, omenaa, viikunaa.
Almost champagne-like. Really bold sweetness and tartness. If the social tensions of Thanksgiving dinner were a beer, it would be this.
Botella de 25 cl, adquirida en Cerveceria Internacional. Color ambar. Sabor afrutado, ligeramente a cereales, levadura.

smells like white delicate wine 
high carbonation, like russian champagne
but in a good way ;)
very sweet, and surpising taste, if you dind drank any Belgians

375 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 11/25/2012. Pours fairly crystal clear deep orange/copper color with a 2 finger dense off white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a light amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of green apple, cherry, strawberry, peach, pear, hay, straw, grass, candi sugar, light vinegar, light musty funk, and yeast earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/funky yeast and candi sugar sweetness; with solid strength. Taste of green apple, cherry, strawberry, peach, pear, hay, straw, grass, candi sugar, light vinegar, light musty funk, and yeast earthiness. Light fruity/earthy tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of green apple, cherry, strawberry, peach, pear, candi sugar, hay, straw, grass, light vinegar/funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice complexity and balance of fruity/funky yeast and candi sugar sweetness; with a nice malt/yeast flavor balance and zero cloying sweetness and after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a smooth and fairly creamy/syrupy mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with no warming present after the finish as expected of 4.2%. Overall this is a very nice Faro Lambic style. All around good complexity and balance of fruity/funky yeast and candi sugar sweetness; and very smooth to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

Bottle from Carrefour, Nice. Golden-brown, no head. Quite a tough little cork to get out of the bottle too. Has a sugary-fruit nose, but this is much more stated when drank and has quite a soured aftertaste.
Pours a clear amber color. Aroma is sour fruits. Taste is sweet with some tartness.

Aroma: champagne, sweet notes.
Appearance: nice amber color, white head.
Taste: low bitterness, sweet notes, slightly sour, fruity
Palate: medium body and high carbonation.
Overall: Quite decent beer.

Bottle 0.25L.
Slightly hazy, deep amber body with large, frothy, off-white head, mostly lasting with some nice lacing; high density of small bubbles.
Moderate malty (grains) and light-to-moderate yeasty (leather) aroma.
Heavy sweet flavour with moderate tartness; finish is mainly sweet.
Light-to-medium body with watery-to-oily texture; fizzy carbonation.

Bottle pour. Pours a black cherry color. Aroma is a sour fruit, mostly cherry. Super sweet beer here. Mostly a cherry flavor with a bit of berry to it. Super fruity. This one seems to get sweeter and sweeter through the finish. Overall, a decent tasting beer. New to this style so I cant necessarily call it unique yet, but its different to me for sure. Enjoyed this beer.

Bottle to goblet
Aroma of brown sugar, overripe apple, lemon peel, cinnamon, and toffee. Pours a clear dark amber with a 2 cm off white head that soon reduces to a thin ring. Taste is cloyingly sweet frim the front, but quickly fading into the expected sourness. Notes of apple, biscuit, and lemon throughout. Enjoyable, but too sweet initially.
Bottle from Lazy Dog. Pours a transparent amber work a thin layer of reddish off white head. Aroma is very tart with some cherries. Taste is super sweet with a hint of funk on the end.

This was probably the first bottled faro - an internal contradiction, as truly traditional faro cannot be bottled, but Lindemans did the same thing as they did with fruit lambics, and made a heavily sweetened, industrialized version of it. Very popular now especially in France. Sourish sweet but the sweet dominates, warm orange colour, frothy head, still some lambic funkiness and in that respect better than their fruit lambics - at least to my personal taste.
une bonne lambic pas chere et désaltérante à recommander, douce et agréablement sucrée.

I was standing at Als of Hampden trying to decide what to get to drink when he told me I should just get one of these because he was trying to kick the keg. I was not expecting a full pint of it but oh well here we go....


A - Pours murky brownish orange with a small half finger tall white head leaving very little lace down the glass.


S - Smells of musty basement funk, lots of sweetness, and some light salt air. Some light fruity aromas are present as well but I cant really detect what they are through all the other things going on.


T - Starts off with lots of candied sugar sweetness slowly giving way to a mix of light fruit, dulled tartness, and even more sweetness. Some mineral like qualities creep in toward the end but the sweetness drowns them out quickly. The finish is, you guessed it, more sweetness with some light funk, lingering on the pallet for some time.


M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Sweet, slightly funk, feel that stays on the pallet for some time after consumption.


O - I had trouble finishing this glass. I have had a few faros before but for some reason this one really got to me. I wont be getting this one again any time soon.

Small head. Low carbonation. Sweet moldy notes. Not pleasant. Not a noble infection. Very sweet. Fruity rotten sour taste. I wonder if it is representativ for their brews.
Not a bad beer has a certain flavor to it maybe could drink 1 or 2 but that would be it.

0.375L bottle. Pours clear amber with a froth off-white head that lingers. Really interesting and unique aroma of sweet-sour cherry (almost like sweet tarts), some basement aromas, . Fairly sweet up front . Transitions to sweet-sour fruit flavors including apple and cherry. Finishes with long, dry sour flavors with some chalkiness on the tongue, similar to a cider almost. Full body with a thick mouthfeel and mild carbonation. Overall, sits on the sweeter side, and doesnt have an overly complex flavor profile. A decent desert beer.
Pours a rose colour, taste is predominately sour, although not quite as sour as the fruit lambics Ive had in the past. Cheers for the bottle Mike1977
Perfectly balanced round sweet sour, hints of caramel, fruity, brown color, diminishing head.
