Sweet sour apple nose. Full bodied barnyard rotting hay juxtaposition against sweet Citric tartness. A small quantity more than sufficient.

Bottle - pours dark amber with little to no head. Nose of brandy, malt, and plums. Taste is of sweet dark cherries, candy apple, malt, and cane sugar.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From corked bottle. Light clear dark reddish color. Aroma is lollipop, sweet funk, and orange gummi candies. Taste is dank tart sourness, sweet candi sugar, prune, toffee, and a hint of bitterness. Quite sweet, but the dank funky tart character pairs well with that. My first beer of this style, and I really enjoy it.
Clean amber color, small beige head. Aroma of sour fruits, oak, malt, sugar and grass. Sour sweet taste. Thin body and lively carbonation.

(Flasche) Es hat eine bronzene Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist sauer, etwas moosig, harzig und spritzig. Der Geschmack ist anfangs süß, medium sauer, sonst wie das Aroma. Bittere gibt es keine. Das Mundgefühl ist spritzig und angenehm.
On tap at Delirium Hoppy Loft, june 20th. Pours hazy dark amber. Aroma is light tart with citrus, cherries, oak, sweet dark sugars. Taste is sweet dark sugars, light tart fruity notes. Medium bodied.
Een heel lekker bier. Een van de beste Faro-bieren dat ik ooit al geprobeerd heb.

DRAUGHT @ DRYGATE BREWERY GLASGOW
 Pours a medium yellow colour 
 aroma is sweetish grain with citric notes
 taste is sweetish with a little sourness,not as sweet as some Faros
 overall ok for the style

Bottle. Clear copper with a frothy white head that quickly disappears. Complex aromas of oak barrel apple cider, vinegar, a touch of barnyard and not a hint of the sweetness to come. Immediate citrus tartness, oak influences, grapes and apple juice sweetness which envelopes the beer. Nice carbonation with quite a thick mouthfeel, although it doesn't linger with sweetness, instead finishing reasonably dry. Faro is a bit sweet for me, but an enjoyable and thought provoking beer nonetheless.

12 oz. bottle from Wilburs. Appearance: slight white head, amber copper color, clear, light lacing, head does not last. Aroma: grapes, oak, leather, prune, awesome yeastiness. Palate: light body, light carbonation, sticky fruit texture, sticky dry finish. Taste: very pleasant sweet fruit, into a malty, overripe fruit taste that balances the sweetness. very slight bitterness. Overall, very pleasant, maybe a bit too sweet, but pleasant.

37,5 cl. bottle. Dark amber colour, with a medium head and good retention and lace. Smell of grapes, apples, sherry, oak, cider. Medium to light body, sour palate, though you can notice clearly the sugar added. Taste is acid apples, oak, cider. Very pleasant, though I like best the usual gueuze with no sugar.
Dark red gold on the eye, very weak white head. Weak lambic aroma, hardly any other notes. Sour taste with fruity notes, sour lasting finish. Bit overcarbonated.

12oz bottle shared. Cop perish red color very clear with small white head. Aroma is of sour, Belgian yeast and candy. Very nice sour aroma. The flavor caught me off guard. Very Belgian candy flavor with a mild sourness on the back side. Smells more sour than what it taste. Nonetheless still very good.
Caramel brown murky. Aroma is a bit of blanket - nice. Taste is very sweet - totally swallows up the sour vinegar vibe. Finish is sickly sweet. Tasty but way too sweet. Real shame.

Świetny orzeźwiający jasno-bursztynowy lambic z aromatem szampańsko-winnym, trawiastym, siennym, drożdżowym, belgijskim. W smaku przyjemnie kwaśne jabłka lub niedojrzała borówka ale na finiszu słodycz - zapewne od tego cukru kandyzowanego. W każdym razie dobrze (ale bez przesady) schłodzone Faro jest doskonałe na dzisiejszą mocno letnią pogodę.
Leuk tussendoortje, fris zurige appel in aroma en smaak. Smaak met iets meer zoetheid, mild en in balans. Licht bruisend.

Bottle, 375ml. An amber sparkling beer with a small foamy head. Aroma is unlike anything I have rated before; sweet but also kind of sour. I think there is some peach, green apple and pear liqueur. A truly unique aroma. Taste is very sweet, although at the end it becomes somewhat sour. There is some carbonation and astringency. Not my style, but I think every true beer lover should taste this.

Bottle, 37.5cl. Sparkling amber with a crispy offwhite head. Sweet, musky sour aroma, with hints of sour apples, fig, oak and barnyard yeasts. Dry and oily, with low carbonation. Earthy acidic character well balanced by the fruity sweetness. Very pleasant.
Bottle from Dranken Geers in Gent. Fruity and tart smell. Sweet and tart taste with ripe fruits and caramellized sugar.
(backlog) Bottle. Brown pour with a slight light lacing. Sweet cane, sugar, a touch of tart malt tones. Flavors are lactic, tart, very sweet(artificial).
Abit soaur aroma. Nice amber colour with rich, but fastly disappearing cap. Rich sour&sweet taste wuth souur and bit bitter aftertaste.

355 ml bottle. Pours a dark amber colour with a large, long lasting, off-white head that laces nicely. Aroma is sweet and sour with some yeast and malt notes. Very sweet flavour with a sour, yeasty finish. Medium body with a sticky texture and soft carbonation.

Bottle. Nice reddish amber color with white head. Aroma is sour with fruits, blackcurrant? Taste is sour with some sweetness some fruits hints of malts. Aftertaste is sour with sweetness and very low bitterness. Nice but a little bit to sweet.
Lasting yellow frothy head atop an orange body. Very light carbonation. Nose of tart cider. Surprisingly sweet, very apple-ly. Minor sour cherry. A bit of a letdown.

Bottle from Getränkefeinkost Berlin. Dark amber pour with a foamy head, aroma is light acidity with some sweet notes. Taste is caramel sweetness with some tart fruitiness with a sticky sweet finish. Very nice

Lindemans Faro Lambic
Color: clear amber liquid, small white soapy head 4/5
From 0,25l bottle. Pours nice clear amber (apple juice like) liquid, minimal fizzy white head. Beautiful rich aroma: apple jucice, cinamon, cider, clove, Taste: medium to heavy sweet, light bitter, medium to heavy sour, aplle juice, aplle puree, spices, fruity, soury, funky.
Palate: medium body, sticky and oily texture, lively carbonation, long sourish fruity aftertaste, long sour sweet aftertaste.
Overall: very interesting, funny beer. I ike it.

Smells of rotting fruits and a little bit of dust and vinegar. Pours very dark orange, almost dark brown, with a small, dissipating head. Tastes sweet, oh so sweet, and sour. Medium body, a bit sticky, below average carbonation, sweet and sour finish. For a fruit wine, itd be too sweet; for a beer, its way too wine-like; and definitely too sweet.

375ml at home. Pours a clear amber color with a quickly fading head. Nose is funky, some light lemony notes. Flavor is sweet up front with a funky, more bitter finish. Raw cane sugar notes all throughout. Its similar to the other lindemans but without fruit. I liked it.

Bottle pour rich copper with moderate light tan head. Nose whole lot a funk. Acetic mixed with citrus. Taste initial tartness is quickly overcome by candy sugar. Then the tart fruit flavors show. Finish reminiscent of candied apples. Carbonation fades quickly leading to a syrupy mouth feel.
Pours reddish amber with a white head. Aroma is sweet, grass and yeast. Taste is sweet fruit.
Pours yellow to orange, sparkling aroma (kinda like cider), very unique acid-sweet taste, carbonation its just fine.

Ambrée. Nez: fruité. Sec. Acide. Vinaigre balsamique. Fruits des champs. Pomme verte. Bleuets. Vanille. Cerise. Framboise. Bouche: très sucré. Belle effervescence. Caramel. Acidulé. Florale. Fruité. Pomme. Citronné. Baies. Très rafraichissante. Succulente.
Hazy deep amber color, small white head. Medium body, soft carbonation. Sugary and fruity aroma. Medium sweet, medium sour taste. Refreshing and somewhat interesting beer.

Cerveja adocicada, quase caramelizada. Não é cerveja para mais de um copo. Deve enjoar. 

Se você é daquele grupo que gosta de harmonizar, pode acompanhar com uma costela de porco com molho agridoce. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Enjoyable and easy to drink. Aroma was fruity with just a hint of oxidation or funk; however, that seemed to subside quickly. It had a pretty copper color with red hues and an off-white creamy head. Medium weight palate with some dryness and good carbonation. Strong flavors of tart fruit and grains. Sweetness followed but not too much. It tasted natural. Quite good.

Bottle from notes. Nose is wardrobes, dust, straw baseline of sugar. Taste is overpowering sugar leading to apple candyfloss and a short dry finish. Faro is an interesting rather than a good style, and its hard to unpick the shortcomings of the style over the beer, but this is just too sweet and lacks depth.
Clear, copper brown. Small white head. Sour, acetic aroma. Woody notes. Similar flavour well balanced by the sweetness. Very good.

A nice somewhat brown, clear beer with a light brown layer of foam, in which some yeast still move around in. A somewhat sour aroma, a little bit like vinegar. A full, sweet-sour taste with some fruit-like hints which hangs on for a while in the aftertaste.

Een mooi, lichtbruin helder bier met een lichtbruine kraag, waar de gistdeeltjes nog in rondzwerven. Een lichtzurig aroma dat lijkt op een soort azijn. Maar een volle zoetzure smaak met fruitige tinten, die nog lekker blijft hangen in de nasmaak.

Bottle. Pours a fairly dark amber with a small, off-white head. Aroma is soda-like, caramelly, sugary. Some sweet cherry candy, light balsamico. Taste is soda-like, caramel, some balsamic vinegar, light cherry candy. Sticky, fairly light, decently carbonated. An alright soda.

Mousse à tenue faible, bullage quasi inexistant. Couleur brun-rouge (on mavait soufflé lorsque je lai bu rhum-coca ... pas le meilleur système mais ça donne lidée ^^). Au nez, on retrouve de la cerise, du chêne et du bois. Lalcool arrive vers la fin avec une note dorge. Au goût, cest le sucre qui note lattaque, suivi du fruit, de la cerise légèrement boisé.
Bière rafraîchissante. Pas mon style mais bonne néanmoins !

Very little foam and carbonation. Red-brown colour (someone whispered when I drank it rhum-coke colour ... Maybe not the best system but it give you an idea). The aroma is dominated by cherry and wood (oak). Alcohol comes at the end with a note of malt. The taste is first hand sugar followed by fruit, cherry slightly woody.
Very refreshing, not my style but very nice !
Bottle at Delirium, Brussels. Hazy amber, steady head. Sweet and lemony nose. Sweet all around, good citrus tartness to match. I like it even if it is very sweet.

Bottle. Schiuma bianca poco persistente, colore giallo ambrato, aroma abbastanza piacevole, di frutta acerba, mela, acetico, di vino invecchiato in botte, al palato discreta carbonazione e corpo medio, si nota immediatamente la dolcezza dovuta soprattutto allaggiunta di zucchero di canna e lacidità del lambic e sovrastato nettamente, daltra parte e lo stile delle faro. In bocca si percepisce comunque qualche nota piacevole di mela, sidro e caramello, non il mio stile di birra preferito ma decente.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2014 Bottle, 37.5cL. Home. Name : "Faro Lambic Foudroyante", 4.2%. 
Bought Supermarket near Grenoble, France, during holidays. In the beginning, I thought it was a different beer !? A clear orange brown beer with a medium white head, poor persistence. Aroma is woody, fruity (apple), acid. Medium sugary sweet with a medium acid/sour background. Light body, thin oily texture, high carbonation, sweet finish a sharp sour note. Overall, I enjoyed this one a lot : nice aroma and taste balance. 8-3-7-4-15
</br>
1st rating : 6/1/2014 : 7-3-6-3-13
Bottle, 25cL. Home. A clear orange brown beer with a medium white head, poor persistence. Few bubbles. Aroma is woody and smoky with apple. This Faro is medium lasting sour and medium sugary sweet. Medium body, thin texture, a bit sticky, soft carbonation, soursweet finish. Overall, a good Faro. Too sweet in my opinion, but I still can appreciate sourness. Pleasant aroma.

Ámbar, con espuma blanca que se disipa rápido. En el aroma el "sour" de las lambic se mezcla con el azúcar, en boca gana el dulce por goleada. No veo la gracia de añadir azúcar a una lambic, pero supongo que tendrá su público.
Bottle pours a cloudy amber with an off white head. Citrus cherry and tart raspberry taste.

Pours a clear deep copper brown with two fingers of fluffy slightly off-white head compacting gradually to a persistent cap and heavy lacing. Nose is candi sugar, cherry, light funk and leather. Taste is sweet and fruity, with a little more sour cobwebby funk than is present in the nose, and some vinous oak. Mouth feel is medium-bodied with sustained moderate carbonation and an off-dry finish.

This is nice. Much sweeter and milder than a gueuze, very similar to a cherry lambic but with more brown sugar and less cherry. The sweetness makes smaller servings appropriate - this would be a very decent dessert beer.

0,25l bottle. Hazy copper color with quickly disappearing head. Aroma is acidic, sugary, barrel and vinous. Taste is sweet with nicely balanced sourness along with barrel and vinous notes. Average carbonation. Its quite refreshing and balanced beer.
Very good balanced sweetness/sourness. Excellent mouthfeel; carbonation and palate. This is my first lambic, and I really like it.
Flaska från Belgianbeerz.com mörkt bärnstensfärgad vätska med vitt skum som lägger sig relativt fort. Doftar sur cider. Väldigt söt fruktdricka med en svag belgisk ton. För söt men helt ok.

Bottle 37,5cl, cork topped by a crown cap. Clear orange amber color, one finger frothy white head, reduces slowly to a couple of millimeters thick persistant layer, nice lacing; sour and sweet nose, candy flavour, cherries, granny smith, yeast; first tarty sweet and sour taste, followed by more natural fruity sweetness; light to medium body, sticky texture, lively carbonation; soft well-balanced sweet and sour finish. I like it.
Pours amber brown with a thin off white head. Aroma of caramel malt, funk, oak, and candi sugar. Tastes sweet, malty, slightly tart, funk and oak.

Appearance: this beer pours with a medium beige head, the beer is a very nice ruby color, seems clear but kind of dark to tell
Aroma: cherry, sweet, grain, creamy, a bit faint but seems complex
Taste: cherry, a strong sweetness throughout, some tart, tangy, 
Palate: has a thick mouthfeel, leaves mouth wet, minimal aftertaste, 
Overall: kind of reminds me of a very sweet red wine, its a good beer but not something I would go for very often
Light red colour with off-white head. Aroma of sour fruit. Taste is sweet with a little wry taste in the background.
Bottle from Binnys Southloop. Poured dark amber with thick beige head. Aroma of slight barn hay sour fruit. Light carb med bod. Quite fruity strawberry, raspberry hay etc. decent

Tasted from bottle. Pours a clear amber copper color with white head. Aroma is mostly sour with some fruity floral aroma. Taste is not as sour as the smell. Mild sour taste with moderate sweetness. Very sticky mouthfeel. Really clings to the palate. Not bad but drinking more than a snifter would be too much. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Slightly sour smell. Very sweet and a bit sour. Really carbonated. The sweetness is too out of balance for me.
Butelka. Barwa bursztynowa. Aromat słodki, owocowy, karmelowy, lekko winny. W smaku jest słodkie, owocowe, cukierkowe z kontrującą kwaśnością.
perfectly balanced in sweetness & sours - best of both worlds you get with this one. Better cellar temp than fridge - tastes much richer that way.
Bottle from Bruges.pours amber with a cream head. Nice sour start, before a sugary sweet finish. Notes of citrus, sherbet, and some woody flavours. Quite reminiscent of cider. A little over sweet.
Very sweet sugary aroma with light barnyard funk aromas. Carb and mouth feel are perfect, if anything the carb is a tad low. The finish is wet hay, touches of funk and sweet sugars. Nice.
Bottle, pours hazy amber with white head, nice lacing. Aroma is fruity, with some vinegar note. Taste is fruity, sweet balanced by sourness. Lively carbonation, sublte tart finish.

Aroma: sour fruits, hints of caramel. Appearance: dark gold, hardly any head. 
Taste: medium sweet. Palate: sugary sweets, plum, prunes / dark fruits, caramel. Overall: great Lambic, dry sweetness. Bottle at Belgo Centraal, Covent Garden.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2014 Tap at House of Beer, Cracow.
Pours cloudy amber with small head. Great lacing though. Fruity in aroma; lemons, raspberries. Some funky and sugary notes. Very drinkable and quite tasty; fruity (raspberry, strawberry) with some sweetness coming right before dry finish. Pretty sweet.

/edit 4/11/2014
Bottled version - similar, although served warmer. Appearance was better (poured it myself) and I enjoyed it more, overall.

Aroma is fruity and slightly musty. Very light and subtle texture on the tongue with a mild effervescent carbonation. Sweet and sour cherry and raspberry with a crisp light dry finish. Tastes like cranberry juice with seltzer water. Some oak like barrel aging flavors with a hint of unmalted wheat possibly. Sweet beer that would compliment many light meals, but definitely not a session brew..A little too sweet for multiple offerings.

It was a multi-step process to get the beer in a glass. First you peel off the silver foil protecting the neck of the bottle. Then you pop the cap. And then you pry the cork off. (That is something that I still have yet to master gracefully). Once open it pours an amber orange color with little to no head to it. The initial aroma is simple syrup to me. Also a touch of apple cider Very sweet smelling.

The taste is also extremely sweet. But it is counteracted by a bubbly character and a slight bitterness at the back of the finish. There is a slight hint of tartness tucked into as well. But overall this is not that far removed from an apple cider that uses a more sugary varietal of apple.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2015 Aroma of vinegar, green apples, candy sugar. Flavour is sugary sweetness and tartness. I prefer my Lambic sour and found the added sugar a detriment. Perhaps Im just not a fan of this style.

Pours out a maroon/brown/purple/red that seems to shift with the light. Thick off-white head that sicks around forever. Funky, herbal, and spicy aromas. Its got a big sugar presence that reminds me of eating straight-up powdered cider with a spoon (dont knock it, awesome camping snack). The sugar poured into this provides a delicious counterpoint to the tart and funk. Really smooth and thick mouthfeel. Lingering tangy aftertaste is quite pleasant. Refreshing, tasty, and relatively cheap for the style.
Hazy copper amber color with small head. Aroma is sour, fruits. Flavor is sour but also sweet, fruity.. Not bad.

0.37.5L bottle. Clear copper color, no head. Apple wine aroma. Sweet apple cider taste mainly. Old rotten wood, light caramel, sweet Sultan grape, and old wood again. To much sweetness for me, but very interesting and drinkable also.

Aroma has a medium light acidity with a moderately strong barnyard funk. Light phenolic spice with a medium light earthy, herbal note. Light citrus note and faint grain and oak character. 
Pours a surprisingly clear, copper-amber color with a fairly large, pillowy white head with decent retention that holds a thin film on top and along the edges. Faint lacing and no legs. 
Flavor has a medium light acidity that recedes quickly and finishes with a medium sweetness. Very faint barnyard funk with a bit of oak tannins. Not really any oak character. Sweetness hides and phenolic character as well. No bitterness or hop flavor. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Moderately sticky finish. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall an interesting style of beer and easy drinking, but I definitely prefer gueuzes. The sweetness prevents all the funk and acidity from shining through.

Dark reddish brown pour. Tan head. Acidic fruity aroma. A little cheddar cheese and vinegar. Flavor is a nice sweet apple cider. Some tart acidity, lots of fruit. Cherry. Pretty sweet. I can't complain that it's too much, given that this is the style, but it would be better with less sugar. The sweetness really takes over after a while. Not a beer I'd go back to.
Decent beer. Sour body, with some added sweetness of course. I just dont like this style, its a waste of lambic.

Bouteille 375ml. Couleur cuivre, mousse blanche évanescente laissant un anneau sur les parrois du verre. Arôme de vinaigre de cidre, brett, vineux, boisé léger, barbe à papa?, pomme. Goût de pommes sucrées, acidité moyenne-faible, sucré, malt en arrière-goût. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen. Au fil des gorgées, le sucré éclipse lacidité et cest bien dommage. Beaucoup trop sucré.
Piwo bardzo ciekawe, w zapachu słodko-kwaśne owoce. W smaku rozpoczyna się od kwaskowości, następnie pojawia się słodycz i lekka goryczka.

Small white head, dark brown copper head, sweet apple sourginger soft biscuit cinamon in the end smell, medium fresh carbonation sweet sour apple jonagold like difficult to place a bit of ginger taste soft sticky
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch säuerich, fruchtig, süß. Geschmack säuerlich, fruchtig, malzig, trocken.
Une bière très péttillante et désaltérante mais son goût devrait beaucoup plus se différencié des autres classiques
Backlog. Bottle at a Systembolaget arranged tasting. Slightly too sweet for me.

Taste is extremely sweet, to sweet for me, and the sweetness overpowers what subtle hints of fruit and maybe brown sugar there are. Drinkability is average at best. This is way too sweet for me to drink more than once

Pours a dark amber with a thin head that fades away very fast. Fruity, tart aroma. Thin bodied and very carbonated. Sweetest beer Ive ever tasted. Way too sweet for me. This is the first time I will use the term "cloying" to describe a beer. There IS something alluring about this beer though. Overall I wasnt completely dissatisfied, but the sweetness just overwhelmed everything about this beer to me and thats just about all I remember of the experience.

Poured from 355mL bottle. Clear, orangey-brown with minimal off-white head, very tiny amount of sediment. Aroma slightly sour, some cherry and mild funk, but also a sweet maltiness. Taste has some of the mild sour characteristics of a typical lambic, but also a fair amount of sweetness (could give this to some of my friends who may not be able to take a full sour yet). Finish quite dry, but very bland. Medium-light body, slight oily texture.

Poured from tap to glass. Orange amber hue with white head that dissipated very quickly. No head retention to speak of. Aroma is cherry, tangerine, acetic, wildflower honey, evergreen huckleberry, sugar. Mouthfeel is surprisingly nice with medium light body but with lacking carbonation. Taste is sweet throughout with a slight acidic finish. Overall this is very sweet but tasty. Almost juice-like.
Pours amber. Nose is funky and musty. Flavor is insanely sweet and flavorful.. damn wow
Tasty beer. Light aroma with no distinct scents. Nice dark brown color. Little head. Sweet and tangy.
Solid lambic. I wasnt a fan of the aroma as much as the flavor. The aftertaste is amazing. Very carbonated, sugary and sweet on the tongue.
From a bottle. Pours hazy ruby brown with a fizzy off white head. Tastes sweet, like cherry and strawberry juice, light fizz. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like yeast and berries.

Capped and corked bottle from QFC, in an effort to track down remaining style ticks. Pours clear, dark amber with creamy khaki head and big old chunks of sediment, though thats probably on me and my not-even-remotely careful pour. Aroma: tart, vinegar, funk, sulfur (in that light-struck sort of way); tart green apples and pie cherries, sitting perhaps in a sugary syrup but without covering the underlying tartness. Taste: quite sugary sweet (which I guess is too be expected, though the nose didnt really prepare for this), but with a nice barnyard funky balance to keep this from being cloying. Pretty interesting, really. Palate: syrupy texture, average to lively carbonation, light-medium body. Overall: you know, this isnt half bad. Especially at 4.5% ABV, reasonably refreshing -- Id drink this again.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2014 Bottle, many thanks Cuso for this style, small bubbly head, a little hazy light copper colour, aroma of vinegar, leather, fruit and some woodiness, white fruit and apple flavour with a hint of spiciness, quite sweet but balanced nicely by light sourness. I wouldnt say this was this one of my preferred styles of  lambic but is still highly  enjoyable and easy to drink.

Deep garnet pour. Nose of leather, pear, strawberry, and fruit skins. Flavor is initially sweet pear and strawberry juice that finishes quick with a light, tart finish. Lingering leather and gentle floral funk. Interesting.
Clear red brown appearance, medium head and carbonation. Green apple and acetaldehyde aroma, sweet and sour. Good Faro style beer.

Cold bottle, into tulip.  Orange / brown, hazy, lightly sparkling, no real head - just a ring of bubbles.  Smell - sour lemon and peach, slight metal.  Body is medium, nice level of carbonation, sticky mouthfeel - seems to be holding a lot of sugar which makes the body a bit syrupy.  Taste - more peach, tart and sweet, lightly acidic, drying raspberry finish.  Nice in small quantities.
Way too sweet. Maybe Belgians like this style, but no thanks. The 'Belgian Candi sugar added' (on the bottle) explains a lot. Think port wine meets Brettanomyces. Ick
12oz bottle. Clear amber, average white cap, sticky spotted lacing. Aroma of apples, raspberry, candy, barnyard. Taste is upfront sweet and bursting tartness. Syrupy and lingering light dryness.

Reviewed from notes. Consumed last summer.
The appearance is a semi-dark golden hazy body with a one and a half finger white foamy head that dies within a minute and leaves thick speckled foamy lacing clinging to the glass.
The smell has a sweet yet a decent dose of tartness, mainly cherry and somewhat sugary.
The taste is basically the same with a cherry aftertaste and dry finish.
The palate has a light to medium sort of body with a nice sessionable aspect to it. Carbonation is good for me, but this is my first faro so Im unsure if this is good for the style.
Overall, wow from me. What a nice after dinner treat, tart yet sweet, but balanced and not overbearing in any aspect, just really good and impressed me, Id definitely have this again.

Bière de fermentation spontanée avec au nez un arôme de levures sauvages répulsif. Odeur de pipi de chat, voire de caca... légèrement trouble, de couleur ambrée avec une mousse légère. Très sucrée. La Faro qui avait pratiquement disparu dans les années 1920 revient à la mode. Pas ma mode en tous cas car je naime pas les bières sucées. Ce sucre vient dajout de sucre candi lors de la fermentation en bouteille. Arômes de pomme, de poire (?), de poivre et dépices pimentées. Intéressante mais pas assez subtile et pas assez acide. Goût légèrement amer en finale, métallique.

Aroma - the aroma is somewhat barnyard in nature, somewhat vinous and somewhat sweet undertones, like white fleshed fruits (apples & pears). If you glean even deeper, youll find a high quality cheese like aroma, that again points back to that barnyard aroma.
Appearance - the color is an amber color, sort of like a clear honey. The head is white, and from initial pour settles fast, and quickly becomes a thin 1/8" slice of white head.
Taste - is a combination of initial sweetness, and a tart apple like transition
Palate - the body is light. The texture very thin. The carbonation on the tongue very fizzy, nice effervescence. The finish holds a nice sweet and sour on the tongue. Later in the experience there is a little must that shows up on the tongue.

This is my first Faro, and I quite enjoy it. Its a unique experience. Its kind of like a cross between champagne and perry cider. I would very much be interested in trying more from the category.

The appearance fuses a slightly hazy copper color with a medium off-white head, and the aroma blends sour fruit, some malts, and a funky yeast. The taste is very nice with its mild sweetness and mild sourness, and the palate slick texture, average carbonation, medium body, and a sour finish. Everything in this beer complements everything else, which creates a very enjoyable brew.

Bottle
Aroma-apple, fruits
Appearance-dark amber, clear, white foam, 
Taste-medium sourness, light sweetness, 
Palate-light body, thin feel, average carbonation, sour finish
Overall-very refresi

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2014 Pours brown and a little hazy with minimal head. Sour and wild barnyard-like aroma with caramel hints. Very crisp and sour taste. // Zapach z butelki: Karmelowy, kwaśny, stajenny.

Piana: Bardzo nietrwała, szarobiała, redukuje się do cienkiej warstewki.

Kolor: Brązowe - w kolorze skorupy orzecha laskowego. Nieco zmętnione, w toni unosi się trochę kłaczkowatego osadu.

Zapach: Karmelowo-likierowy, kwaśny, ziołowy, stajenny.

Smak: Kwaśno-słodkie. Kwaśność ostra, niemal drażniąca, piekąca. W tle karmel.

Tekstura: Pozostawia cierpki osad na zębach. Nieco szczypiące, a przy tym gęste i syte, prawie zawiesiste.

Nasycenie: Niskie.

Goryczka: Umiarkowana, cytrusowa, ostra, wręcz chemiczna.

Pijalność: Niska.


Faro od Lindemansa było moim pierwszym starciem z lambikami. Wprawdzie kiedyś, bodajże w roku 2009 piłem jakiegoś krieka, jednak było to piwo ewidentnie dosłodzikowane, smakowało jak owocowa oranżada. Muszę przyznać, że przeżyłem spory szok, stajenne nuty w połączeniu z intensywną kwaśnością w pierwszej chwili skojarzyły mi się z wymiocinami i musiałem nieźle się skupić, żeby to skojarzenie "pominąć" w dalszej degustacji. Piwo nie przypadnie do gustu każdemu, jednak w mojej opinii warto poznać ten specyficzny bukiet wrażeń. Faro z Lindemansa kupiłem w jednych z Warszawskich hipermarketów Carrefour za około 8zł.

Bottle. Pours clear orange red with quickly settling, off-white head. Aroma is sour apple, sugar, candy. Flavor is sweet, candy apple, sugary finish. Soft carbonation, medium body, and sugary, syrupy texture. Friggin sweet.

Clear copper, almost no head. Very fruity: peach, grapes, berries. Nice subdued funky notes with some dough and caramel. Taste is very sweet, with nice tart finish. Medium bodied, prickly carbonation. Overall very nice stuff, though it really is sweet.

Bottle from Beers of Europe via Martin (Sarkynortherner) cheers mate; cloudy dark amber pour with smooth off white head, decent funky aroma, taste has citrus and some sherbet dip sweetness surprised at the amount of sweetness but works well with the sour lambic action. Ive got 2 more styles to go, Ive got 2 more styles to go (so solid style). Sorry Ill get my coat.

Deep ruby red, hazy with some yeast particles I accidentally poured, really short head, bit sparkling. Really sweet aroma with berries (cherry at least) and maybe bit apples. Sweet, medium body, round and quite soft feel, sweet finish is medium long, soft carbonation, dessert beer kinda feel. Tasty and quite natural feel, really sweet and would probably work best as dessert.

E stato il mio primo impatto con una faro e non mi ha impressionato troppo positivamente. Prevale un gusto dolciastro, che ricorda la frutta candita, mentre le note acido-acetiche (che mi aspettavo più marcate come si addice a un lambic) sono invece scostanti e smorzate. Così, così ma tutto sommato piacevole.

Bottle. Dark copper-brown pour with thin but persistent white head. Aroma of green apples, pie dough, cherries, light acetic notes. Taste is tart, cherry flavor, fruity sweetness. Palate is light-med bodied with light carbonation. Better than I expected.

Foamy beige head with bitter typical lambic flavors. Light copper transparent body. Bitter and not too sweet. Excellent balance to satisfy men and women.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smell is very fruity of some dark fruits. Also some lambic sourness in smell. First taste is rather sweet but sourness comes right away and stays quite long in palate taste is a wired combination of sweetness and sourness. Not my kind of beer.
UPDATED: JAN 5, 2014 Dunkel rødbrun farve med lyst skum. Lukt av malt og sherry. Smak av malt, sherry og søte bær. Søt vinøs karakter. Import.
Fin duft av friske druer og andre frukter. Lite skum. Dunkel rødbrun farge. Fin smak av druer med en litt søt/syrlig ettersmak. Kjempegodt.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Hazy reddish orange beer with medium head. Aroma of cherry drops and a touch of vinegar. Taste is cherry drops, sweet candied fruit, some sourness and malts. You can feel the sugar on the tongue, nicely carbonated. Really good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at The Fiddler. Pours hazy amber with a small off white head. Aroma is funky and fruity. Flavour is moderate sweet and light to moderate acidic. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Beaucoup mais alors beaucoup trop sucrée. Quelques touches de fleurs au nez mais le sucre ultra présent gâche tout pour moi. Cela dit, c'est une bière facile à appréhender pour les non amateurs.

Only number I can see is HO3LFA on the lower back label. Would assume this is in the 1-3 year old vicinity. The bigger question is, why am I drinking this? 375mL bottle drunk on 12/31/13. Initially smells reasonably tart, with some white flour and lemon notes. That gives way pretty quickly to full-on paper, vegetal and powdered sugar notes. Yum! Light amber-colored body is clear and reasonably retains the off-white head.Notes of strawberry rhubarb are heavy up front, leading to simple syrup and malt vinegar on the finish. There is a somewhat pleasant tartness in the mix, but its heavily, heavily outclassed by the candi sugar dominance and already poor base that is Lindemans (non-cuvee rene) gueuze. Kind of like a sweeter version of that already too-sweet beer. Hey, you know what you shouldnt do to lambic before bottling it? Nothing to see here, moving on....
Bu en pression en 25cl, une bière dune couleur très ambrée, très sucre candy, peu de mousse. En bouche on a limpression de sentir que de la pomme pas désagréable mais trop sucrée.

A: Brown-golden ale. Excellent clarity. single finger peanut head falls quite quickly to a shiny surface. No lacing.

S: Up front, very sweet. Quite syrupy, sweet and sour oranges. Some farmy tones, evident wild yeasty flavors. 

T: See "S". Then intensify the sweetness. The beer is like candy. I cant imagine this beer coming in a bottle any larger than 12oz - too much, unless for a party.

M: Body is like a light syrup from a can of fruit. Sticky feel. Slick on the finish. Medium carb.

O: Well done from what I understand the style to be.

Serving type: bottle

04-25-2011

Wet hay, Brett, soapy, fresh earth, tang. Pours brilliant orange/Amber with a bubbly off white head that dissipates to a fingernail with good lacing. Quite sugary sweet, with backgrounds similar to the aroma would be much more pleasant with less back sweetness.

Antrunk ist mild-süffig. Im Hauptteil wird die Lambic-Säure sehr mit Zucker abgemildert. Das entstandene Aroma hat was von süßem Senf - die sauer-süße Note bleibt lange auf der Zunge erhalten. 

Leider nicht mein Fall - die süße Note ist irgendwie komisch, das ganze wirkt aber schön rund. Und außerdem ist mir positiv aufgefallen, dass in der Zutatenliste keine chemischen Zusätze oder Hilfsstoffe aufweist! 
Aber sonst


Test vom 16.4.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,8,12,6,13,7 - 8,55

Bottle to glass, dark red amber body with a thin white head. Nose is dominated by yeast and funk. Taste is slightly tart up front, rushes into a sweet body with some barn bitterness, and a musty finish. Too sweet.

Amber color , thin white head. Aroma is sour, cherry , hint of honey and yeast . Taste cherry , tart in beginning and sweet in finish . Normal , but very sweet as for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at Aces and Ales. Pours clear amber with a white head. Scent of sour cherry, clove, honeydew melon. Flavor is sour cherry, grape peel, tropical fruit. Very nice.

250 ml bottle shared with the metallurgist. Reddish amber with thin off white head. Aroma is sour, earth, dark ripe fruit, dark sugar and some malty sweetness. Taste is at first aggressively sour but is quickly balanced by various sweet notes, malt and dark fruit mainly. Very pleasant at first but the last half of the bottle is too sweet.
Du très bon jus. Rien de plus. Pour manger sa foot être assez bien. presque pas de mousse..

Pours a brownish amber, with no head. Aroma of tart apples, bit of cheese, and "ferment-y" (?) malt. Taste is tart and sweet, only slight bitterness. Finish is short. Sticky mouthfeel. Nothing to write home about for a lambic, or maybe just not a fan of the Faro style.

Bottle (355ml): Amber brown. Clear, Medium to light head. Sour aromatics. Obviously bacterial or bretty. Funky, mouldy apple, candy apple & malt. Sweet, Sour and moderate bitterness. Almost phenolic. Feels moderately to highly carbonated with fine bead. Candy and decaying apples. Hint of caramel. Medium weight and length. 
To funky and manufactured for me. Lacks the balance and class of the Framboise.

25cl bottle. Rose pink coloured, thin white head disappears completely quickly. Sour, earthy, yeasty nose, some sugary summer fruit notes too. Nose drifts between attractive and offensive. Flavour is sweet up front - really sweet. Strawberry notes, some cherry too. Theres some sourness to follow, sour apple notes here. Light and very fizzy. Finish is yeasty, estery, sweet and sour. Areal roller coaster this and a great example of an out there beer.

BB 2015, 0,375 bottle. Appearance dark amber with white head. Head stays for a moment . Aroma of cherries, hints of berries,promise of sourness and sweetness, also noticable aroma of acidity. Medium carbonation. Taste is strongly sour and sweet with bitterness in the background, but there is also distracting watery taste present. Finish is sour with watery taste. Overall: generally I like sweeter lambics, but this isnt as great as I expected. Still it goes down well, and that deserves always a couple of extra points.

From the bottle marked L-H10JFA. It pours amber-copper with some yellow hues around the edge of the glass. A modest head. Cherry fruit tends to be the leader of aroma with some roasted malts but nothing in the way of wheat. Light to medium body. Again, like the nose, the cherry character kicks in but unlike the nose it ends on the tart side.

I am a fan of Lambic in general but it turns out I am not a fan of Faro. Funk comes through in the nose with a sweetness to boot. Flavor is lambic funk in the background with a sweetness cutting through the funk. A little to sweet for me.
Light orange with big head. Aroma of sour apple, lemon and candied lemonzest. Taste of green apple, candied orange/lemon zest and brown sugar, My first faro, tasty
Aroma of champagne and fruits. Sweet fruity taste, especially apples with strong sour finish.
Bottle. Color was a crisp amber with a small head. Aroma was funky and strange. Flavor was crisp, apple, sweet, and tart. First of the style.

Bottle; poured a bog water brown. Aroma of funk, farmhouse, yeast, apple and sugar. Fairly sweet up front giving way to apples and crystal sugar. Touch of funkiness and tartness throughout and in the finish especially. Crisp and refreshing. Quite good.

Pretty funky, pretty unusual to me, but I liked it. Sweet, sour, sticky palate and feel is the strength. Weakness is the bizarre barnyard nose that takes some getting used to. Odd but interesting flat and auburn color, light head on top, no lacing. Got it in Erie at Wegmans.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2015 It has a slightly hazy red color and a semi-large but quickly disappearing head. There is also high carbonation present. The aroma is sweet and citrusy with some hops noticeable. Taste is soury, cider-like or fresh wine-like. Its sweet and really sour at the same time, plus there is lots of carbonation here. A bit weird, but ok.
Bottom Line: thought I was drinking a cider, and Im not a cider fan. Cloudy with sediment, smells very sweet. Tart finish. Wouldnt drink it often.
Aroma of sourdough and honey. Toffee coloured, sweet taste with a slightly sour finish.
Hazy, copper color with minimal, short lasting head. Aroma of yeasts and fruits. Doesnt have bitterness. Taste is fruity and sweet, medium sourness. Flat carbonation.

375mL bottle with crown seal...and cork!? Bb 30jan2015
Pours an interestingly coloured clear copper beer with small but tight persistent white cap.
Restrained aroma. Nice bit of cheesy funk, typical of a Lindemans, hay, cereals, faint barnyard without the horse. Some dried fruits and burnt sugar.
Restrained carbonation...at least in lambic terms...some viscosity to it but still light bodied, appreciable acidity. 
Burnt toffee sweetness carries through the palate, Notes of dried fig, raisin and grainy malt along the way. Low bitterness to finish, still comes out somewhat sweet.
Very different to anything Ive come across. Almost reminiscent of an old sweet white wine. Bit of a stepping stone up to serious lambic.

Pours amber with robust head, which quickly remains as a ring. The aroma is of bubble gum and champagne. The taste is sour and crispy. A lot of sweetness. No hoppiness. Intensive aroma. No unpleasant notes. Well crafted. Sour finish.

Surprisingly tart and sweet at the same time. Almost like a pungent cherry beer because of its fruity bright taste. Nice solid amber colour with a light frothy head that dissolves quickly.

I pick up on some sour herby notes, that I imagine could put some people off. But it does taste like beer either way and I like it.

Fun gimmick with the bottle cap concealing a cork
Bottle. Reddish-brown colour with small off-white head. Caramel, malt aroma, slightly fruity. Brown sugar, caramel, candy sweet taste. Also sour and fruity. Light to medium body.
Way too sweet! Can't handle it, tiny tart body. Drain pour on this one.
Light amber pour with light beige head. Aromas of musty wood, apple, grape, berry and pear. Flavors are in line with the aroma with a sweetness that lingers on the palate.

Bottle Pour. Dark amber color with a very fizzy pour. Light tan head. The aroma is very sour, and sweet. The taste is fizzy on the tongue with a very sour finish. Overall a very sweet sour, not one of my favorites, but a good pick.
Musty nose from a dark amber clear pour. Slight off white head. Sweet taste with an apple juice like finish. Refreshing. Nice!
sweet and not that nice! faro isnt the greatest style out there but this is not a good example of what it should be according to me!
amber, hazy, minimal head, white foam, hay, roasty, citrus, leaves, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter,
amber, clear, white foam, dough, leaves, herbs, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, medium sweetness, medium bitterness,

Presentation: It was poured from a green capped and corked 355ml bottle into a Lindemans fluted glass. The label has a description of the beer but there is no freshness date or abv%. 

Appearance: Its dark in the glass with a bronzy amber colored body held up to light. It has good clarity and some visible carbonation. A good two finger head caps of the beer. Its off white in color and tightly packed. On the glass it leaves some spotty lace. 

Smell: There are notes of white bread, raw grain and wheat malt with a hint of sweetened whiskey or sweet brandy. 

Taste/Palate: It is candy sweet up front with notes of white bread, sweet caramel, and nougat. Some tangy wheat and yeast tartness just tries to sneak in as some fruit notes like sweet apple peach and pear lead into a stick sweet finish. The palate is medium bodied, smooth and slick. On the lips it feels sticky. 

Notes: Im not quite sure what to think of this beer. My palate is confused, is it a tart beer trying to be sweet or a sweet beer trying to be tart/sour. It is interesting if nothing else.
UPDATED: OCT 28, 2013 Smells like fermented sugar, tastes like fermented sugar. Dont love the style but this is a good one fpr the category.

Just my second Faro beer. Not very familiar with the genre, but out of the two, this wasnt the best one ;) Its too sweet to enjoy for me. Has a fruity base of pear, apple and something funky like marzipan combined with soap or something. The the sourness kicks in, which is the special part of this beer, balancing the sweetness out somewhat, resulting in kind of a overload flavor sensation. Thats the part i like, but the flavor base is not my thing and its just too sweet without much depth.

The beer pours decently with a clear amber body, a nice one finger creamy white head, and leaves some lacing on the glass. The beer smells mildly sweet of pear, apple, and candied sugar. The taste is great with a fruity flavor with a pear, sour apple, and plum blended together. The mouthfeel is decent as the beer was well carbonated and you are left feeling with a crisp, clean mouth. Overall, your typical quality lambic from Lindemans with an interesting flavor.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2013 Pours A wonderful deep cobber red with bad head retention. Aroma is brett, funk, fruit and candy. Very Nice sticky sweet mouth feel. Aftertaste is sweet with some sourness. Overall: Very enjoyable.

Faro to według mnie najlepszy pomysł na nietradycyjnego lambica. Bo jak może komuś nie smakować belgijskie piwo o smaku porto z wyraźnymi nutami kwasowości? Ok, może komuś może, ale ja się nie zaliczam do takiej grupy osób. To piwo spełniło wszelkie oczekiwania, aż strach pomyśleć jak pyszne mogłoby być jakieś z wyższej półki w tym stylu. Już zbieram kasę!
Det här var en god sak med en intressant blandning av sötma och syra. Kroppen var i minsat laget men balansen var närvarande och smaken bar toner av druva, äpple och sötma.
Belle couleur ambrée. Pas de mousse ni carbonation. Belle surprise! un gout sucré-acidulé très agréable. Fin de bouche aussi sucré_acidulée. A re-boire!
Skulle väll kunna ta detta lite som ett desert öl! Väldigt söt och fruktig i smaken. Mycket karamell. Aromen är BRA, smaken är himmelsk. Fin kropp och balans för en lambic.
Bottle. Orangey amber body with a medium white head. Nose is oak, acid, champagne, hops, wheat, raspberries. Taste is sour with some sweetness. Tart, acid finish.
Stor söt doft, vinös smak med toner av jäst och fatkaraktär. Rund och len men en lite överdriven sötma. Godis.

bottle at home. Faro tick! Colour is onion skin brown. Thin scummy white head. Some fizz to begin with. Aroma is funky caramel some chive, slightly musty. Flavour is quite sweet but not as much as I had feared. slight tart in the finish. A bit of sweet and sour going on. Slightly sickly. Im glad this is a small bottle, but interesting enough.

I think this is my first faro lambic. Cork and capped bottle. Clear brown rust color with no head. Aroma at first was a bit off but strong sour barley sugar with a bit of barnyard and burlap sack. taste is sour a little and super sweet, touch or orange. taste is a little like french orange liquor
Copper orange beer with very little head. Aroma is sweet fruits and acidity. Flavour is sweet malty and fruity.

Pours a reddish brown with a medium off white slightly creamy head. Aroma and taste is fruity, berries, sweet raspberry hints of strawberry, yeast and a bit of biscuit malt with mild tartness at the end. A medium body with lively carbonation, light bubbly and crisp on the palate. I found this brew to be quite enjoyable, crisp and refreshing without being too sweet. Very nice tasty brew.

37,5cl bottle.
APPEARANCE: clear amber beer, small unstable head.
NOSE: sweet, little sour.
TASTE: sweet, little sour, apple juice like. But altogether not that bad for a faro...

Contrary to many of the reviews I thoroughly enjoyed this beer. Aroma: sweetness and plumb, touch of vinegar. Appearance: amber brown. Taste: sweet sugar, dark fruit, moderate sourness. Medium body. Overall a refreshing faro, tantalizing flavour, bold sweetness, and some sour to balance it out. Not as good as a Duchess de Bourgogne, but enjoyable none the less.

How: Bottle.
Where: Poatersgat, Brugge.
Appearance: Amber colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Sweet malt, caramel, sugar.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Sweet caramel, sugar, some sourness in the finish.

Bottle, crowned and corked. Pours with a soda-like fizz, reddish brown and shiny. A super sweet aroma wafts quite a distance, the sugar quite evident. Drinks with a pretty heavy cherry-laden character, quite nice, but definitely just for the sweet beer lovers. (#5211, 8/25/2013)

sweetness right away, a sour note, some earthy/cork aromas. fruity aromas -- raspberry. estery. theres an aged raspberry/cherry note. the flavor - sweet. sweet battling sourness, and sweet winning. sugary. murky medium amber. minor head that quickly falls. prickly carbonation. rating this feels wrong, since its not an authentic faro. the very thought of bottling a beer with live yeasts and microbes with sugar... this beer must be pasteurized or filtered or both to allow such sugars to exist. ive had real faro at moeder lambic by the train station in brussels. i just wasnt on rate beer at the time, otherwise id have rated that instead.
Bottle with crowncap and cork 0,75 ltr: Clear amber coloured brew, if he sugar is not added in this beer it will be to sour. This beer have some hints of apples, wooden beer barrel and sugar.

Dear sweet baby Jesus. This rating is to warn you. My husband failed me in his marriage duties and only told me this tasted "bizarre." No. False. The pour is like... maybe you had some stomach problems and also a backed up toilet. Which isnt terrible in and of itself. The smell is wet cat food and tuna with just a hint of skunk roadkill. What? Even so, my cat rejected the beer as well. The taste is probably something like rotted meat, but honestly, I cant tell you because I retched, cried and then washed my mouth out. I normally dont like leaving such scathing reviews of a beer, I know the brewer usually puts a lot of time and effort into creating this product. But this? Not sure how you put this on the market. NOPE.

375mL. Pours low haze tea brownish amber. Thicker head than expected with good retention. Nose is skunky off the bat, green bottle perhaps, dark bread, sweet cherry. Taste is really something, apple cider, nasty sugar component. Something savory but not tasty like Salisbury steak. Lemon acid with something really off putting like cafeteria gravy or something. Very bizarre. Wife said the aroma is skunky with wet cat food. Canned tuna fish. Taste is, well, she started crying and dropped the glass on the floor while I was balling laughing. Lots of crying and laughing. She said it was the worst beer she has ever had in her whole life. She had a gag reflex. As it warms Im getting more and more convinced by my wife that it tastes like rotting vegetables, Salisbury steak, cat food, canned tuna, and lime juice. Its pretty awful. Perfect drain pour. Thanks Scavenger Hunt. Hopefully these points come in handy

Una faro bastante interesante, con un cruce entre lo dulce y lo agrio que la hace interesante. Además, es relativamente accesible. Entre las faro/lambic de gran acceso, es de las que más auténticas parecen. Posgusto seco, pero con remanentes de dulzor.

Bottle. Clear brown/copper liquid with small to medium white head. Aroma of funk, raw sugar, lemons, bread, apples and red berries. Taste is light to medium sweet and light sour with notes of raw sugar, funk and lemons. Light to medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice but too sweet

Pour is a fairly clear for a lambic. Light red color. A bit of funk in the aroma. Flavor is very sweet. Fruity light cherry flavor, a slight sourness in the back but barely. Medium body and fairly flat.

Bottle thanks to senseimike. Nearly flat. Pours a a dark amber/red. Nose is slightly tart. Taste is the same with a lingering acidic finish while still sugary sweet. Slight pepper and a late pucker. Not bad. Wouldn't buy more. 

---Rated via intercellular device

25cl. Bottle. 
Pours clear brown with white head. 
Aroma sugar, sour cherry, sweet fruits, cassis. 
Taste very very sweet, sour finish. 
Mouthfeel bit sirupy.
Poured from a cold bottle. Clear auburn color, nice white head. Sour malt smell. Sweet candy taste, slight malt, and fruit.
Smells like sugar and fruit punch. Very red, like Hawaiian punch. Very think and pungent. And really, really sweet. Like Kool Aid mixed with Diet Sprite. This is too weird to rate.
Just to sort out some beers I have had, but didnt rate. Bottle at home, It was an interesting beer, strange sweet/sourness, it was drinkable but i had a hard time drinking the complete bottle.

Belle bière cuivrée au reflets roses, à peine voilée et couverte dune fine écume créant une légère dentelle au verre. Des arômes riches de framboises, de raisin blanc et dagrumes. Elle est bien aigre et assez sucrée. Elle est lisse, très effervescente, de corps léger et se termine sur de longs arômes et une aigreur rafraichissante

Love me some Lambic! Aroma- smokey, mint, sour apple, and menthol (wow). Well balanced sweet apple flavor with a mellow sour aftertaste. The aroma is the only thing holding this beer back from a 4.5 or higher.

My first Faro! Pours dark amber/copper with a nice white head that disappears quickly. Aroma is sour apple, vinegar, and definite mint presence. Flavor is a sweet and sour apple, vinegar, nice lingering green apple presence. This is really neat, and the minty smell is strange but somehow good. Easy drinking, lots of carbonation, and a slick mouthfeel. Good stuff.
Tumman kullankeltainen väri, niukka vaahto, tuoksussa ei havaitse juurikaan makeuden lisäksi mitään, maku suloisen makea, aivan vallan mainio makea lambic. Sanoinko jo että tämä on makeaa?

Drank this at Ashleys in Westland during the Belgian festival. Way different than I expected. Didnt have a sugary sweetness like all other Lindemans. Dry, tasty, a little bready. Would drink again for a decent price.

Pours amber with off-white head. Aroma from far away is very similar to Cuvee Rene, get a hint of the underlying funk. Funk is still evident when I take a closer sniff, but the caramel sweetness from the sugar comes to the fore. Upon tasting, the immediate sensation on the tongue is some acid and lemons. That disappears quickly though as my palate is then consumed by caramel and sugar. Mouthfeel is average and bubbly. Finish is sugary and tart. Pretty good beer. Only faro better than this in my book is Straffe Winter, which is quite a different beast.

355 ml bottle courtesy of Jesterdeal. Thanks. Pours a hazy amber color with a small beige head that soon recedes to a fine ring. The aroma is pungent with ripe green apples and some mild funk. The taste, like the aroma, features green apples, sour melons and rock candy. The palate is light but effective and the carbonation is soft. Finishes long and rock candy sweet. Overall: I dont have much experience with Faros but I really liked this. Tasty stuff.
Clear red pour with a decent head. Sweet and sour. Aroma of fruit, but mostly a dry experience.

Pours amber orange with a white head. Aroma of sugar, malt and sweets. Some hints of apple. Flavour is apple. Quite sweet with a light sour taste. Very interesting, never had anything like this before.

Bottle from the beer palais at Watou, Belgium. Pours murky brown, and from the first sip it bursts forth with a syrupy sweetness that feels lively on the palette. Has definite cider qualities, overly ripe fruit, apple core, cherries and a tartness followed by distinct sour elements. Enjoyed it but not sure whether Ill have another.

250ml bottle. Pours out orange with a quickly receding white head. Smells sweet and earthy/wild, with plenty of damp wood notes. Taste is initially a real melange of tangy, jam-like forest and orchard fruits. Moves through that intriguing clash of sour and sweetness. Surprisingly tasty at times.

37.5cl bottle from Carrefour (Belgium). Pours dark amber in color with a small white head that vanishes into a lacing. Grapes, caramel and earthy notes in the aroma. Medium to low carbonation. Starts light bitter but turning quickly to a light sour, medium sweet flavour with a dry end. Maybe too sweet for me.

Dark clear amber with quite a bit of sediment. Aroma of apple cider vinegar, funk, tannins, yeast, malt syrup. Flavor is very sweet for a lambic. Not much flavor; Mapley, lemony.  This made me go "WHOA" because of how it has both a saccharine feel on the tongue and substantial dry finish.

Rood, licht troebel met minimale kraag
Aroma: licht zuurtje, kersen
Smaken: redelijk zoet, licht zuurtje van kersen fruitig
Matige body, heerlijk, jammer van het kleine flesje.!
UPDATED: JUL 18, 2013 Bottled. Pour dark golden with no head. Smell is of a true lambic. Taste of fruit and berries.
Rated in 2010 (Backlog) - Amber in color with a small white head. Aroma is of sugar, wood and caramel. Taste is of raisin, sugar, caramel and yeast.

From notes: Poured into a Lindemans flute- amber color similar to that of a good ginger ale, with a 4-finger bone-colored head. Aroma of earthy yeast with some sourness and a touch of sweetness underneath. Medium body with a syrupy thickness to it. Flavor is mildly sour. There is a touch of sweetness underneath that has a somewhat caramelly quality to it. Interesting.
Pours a nice brown amber beer with a good white head. Dont smell very good. A bit like vomit. Tasted a bit to sweet. little sour.
Pours orange color with small head. Taste is fruity, some caramel, too sweet for me. Definitely not my style of beer.

Date Rated: Feb. 3, 2013...
Glassware: Lindemans flute...
Occasion: Super Bowl Sunday--lose Baltimore!...
Appearance: dark copper body with a bright, white, thin hazy head; sediment flecks dance amidst fervent effervescence...
Aroma: flat, funky, punchy pungency; dryish as a wine, buts its wheat keeps the profile in the beer realm...
Palate: medium-bodied and fizzy; willpower must be invoked to keep from slamming the flutes contents...
Taste: sour and tart, as expected--not too puckerish; fruity and rewarding in its full flavor profile...
Overall: Part Super Bowl high, part beer-buying-binge-booty mood, my state of mind may have something to do with enjoying this beer and its style, which I havent sprung for in a while; at $6 a bottle, pricey but provides a worthwhile experience...
Bottle->flute.  Orange/brown with quickly dissipating offehite head.  Sweet fruit, with some sour grapes.  More sweet than sour.  A "just once" beer for me.

bottle, 330ml i think. poured a cherry reddish brown colour with very big head that didnt last too long. aroma of raspberries and other fruits with caramel and raisins present too. taste was very good. at first, it is extremely sour - fizzy throughout - with a full mouth feel. this settles slightly to become a little sweet. very dry. nice.

25 cl bottle. Poors an brown/orange transparent with a small creamy head. Looks like apple cider. Taste is fruity, apple, grapes, then it feels like vinegar with a sour ending. Really interesting flavour, different from other beers, altought I would not drink it so often. Worth a try.
Dark orange colour with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, sugar, dust, hop. Flavour is sweet, sugar, sourness

375ml bottle. Clear reddish golden copper colour with small to average, firm, frothy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, off-white head. Fruity and minimally sourish aroma, hints of raspberry and other red berries with an minimally artificial  touch of sherbet, hints of yeast and mustard prickling in the nose. Taste is initially clearly separated into a sweet fruity part with hints of raspberry and other red berries, and a distinct sourish counterweight; later more integrated with hints of grapes, raspberry vinegar, cocktail sauce, sweet mustard.

Ambrée un rien trouble, pétillance aussi fine que son col. Dominance aigre-douce, goût de cidre de pommes légèrement caramélisées, notes de citron, raisins et cerises, mini-amertume en arrière-bouche, un rien trop sucrée.

Bottle at home. Pours clear golden brown with big white head which quickly goes. Aromas of sugar and cider, maybe white grapes. Tastes sweet and sour, with a sticky texture and long finish. Good, but not a beer Id rush to get again.
Deep red-amber in colour. Aroma was of sugar, cherries, some caramel. Flavour was sour at first, then sweet, with some caramel and sugar. Finishes with a pleasant sweetness.

Bottled 0,33L Braced brown color, medium fraught aspect, good bubbly presence with a medium head resistance. Crisp and little citrus nose, notes of cider, apple, grains and white fizzy wine. Pleasant taste, very sweet with a little citrus notesm good alcoholic balance and long winous final.

My first Faro! Thanks Bruce! 355ml bottle, served in a chalice. Pours a transparent brown with a bit of beige froth for a head. Looks very fizzy. Aroma: Sweet and sour. Bubblegum notes. Hints of maple syrup, caramel, and raisins. Made my mouth water! Palate: Medium bodied, very fizzy, medium-length finish. Smooth. Taste: Very sweet, quickly changing into a burst of sour, then tapering off with a sweet finish. Mix of candy and lemon and raisins. Really nice.
Very good, and refreshing. quite sour but good in al aspects. Nice touches and features too.
Appearance amber effervescent with a slight  off white head aroma dried cherries taste sour cherries long on the palate interesting flavor!

From a 12 oz bottle shared at home.  Pours a clear deep gold with a thin white head.  Aroma of wild yeast.  Barnyard flavors mostly overwhelmed by candy sugar flavors.  A bit sweet for my tastes but pretty nice, nonetheless.  Plus this is my 75th beer style to rate, which makes it pretty special.

Clear very dark amber / reddish hazelnut in colour with smooth body. Nose of something very special, like cherry stones, hops and malt. Taste of cherry stones, lambic-fruit kriek. hay, mild hops and ripe grains. Hints of nuts. Dry but also very sweet finish. This is just a high complex lambic that I really enjoyed and loved to drink. As this is my first Lambic of this style Im willing to re-rate this beer when I got my hands on another Faro.

Once again a tricky one from Lindemans. You can be used to that sour geuze style, but when you come to the end and a slight sweetish taste and aroma hit you from knowhere you know you have an outstanding beer in front of you. Full of aromas, full of great mouthfeel and with an incredible driniking end.
My first lambic. 25cl bottle. Pours brown-amber with a white fast diminishing head. Bready, sweet sour aroma. Flavour is sweet, yeasty, acidic wine, medium sour until the end.

07/05/2013 Bir&Fud Bottega (330ml bottle), Ambrata carica, con lieviti in sospensione, schiuma bianca abbondante ma poco persistente. Al naso sentori di zucchero di canna, lieviti selvatici, leggere puzzette indefinibili. In bocca è un dolcione, succo di zucchero, quasi nessuna traccia di acido. Corpo medio-leggero, carbonazione soft. Pessima.
Bottle. Sour lambic aroma with some sweetness present. Flavour is an abomination - far too sweet with unpleasant earthy elements. I couldnt finish the bottle.

Bottle: &nbsp Chestnut like amber, thin sudsy off-white head, sparce lacing. &nbsp Nice tart nose, very wild lambic like, some bright wheaty notes and a bit of sweet fruity vinegar. &nbsp Hmmm, a bit sweeter on the tongue than the 

nose suggested. &nbsp Tart, not sour. &nbsp Very light dryness. &nbsp Boy sweetness, tartness, and the drying aspect play off each other. &nbsp Not as dry or tart as others, on the sweeter side (which I expected for Lindemans). &nbsp 

Body and mouthfeel are average. &nbsp Finish has somewhat of an artificial sugary sweetness. &nbsp I kinda wish that was a bit duller, and the tartness and dryness to stand out a bit more. &nbsp As is its still fairly tasty and enjoyable 

to drink. &nbsp Pretty much like most other Lindemans, a bit more sweet than others in the style.
12 oz bottle. Poured an amber color with a thin white top and some lacing. Taste of candy apples, sugar, tart, and citrus. Medium carbonation, medium syrupy body. Too sweet for me
Light sweet kinda fruity amber redish pour thin white head small bits floating in beer. It drinks like a Riesling sweet, light, fruity and easy to drink

750 ml bottle, at home, poured into a tulip glass. ABV 4.2%
Light amber orange colour, with lots of tiny bits floating in the body. Two fingers of off-white soapy head, with low retention. A little bit of lacing on the glass.
Aromas of caramel and white grapes with faint cherries notes.
Taste is sweet at first and during the sip, turns to sweet sour on the aftertaste. Very refreshing.
Light on the body, carbonation just a bit above average, on good levels.
Nice beer, quite refreshing as I already wrote.

12 oz bottle from Wilburs into my Duvel tulip.  Copper colored and pretty clear with a small off-white head.  2nd pour was cloudy and full of sediment.  Fruity, sweet candy aroma, lightly tart with brown sugar.  Really sweet and fruity, chalky and yeasty with a dry finish.  The flavor is just too sugary/sweet for me.

Amber-brownish liquid, fast receding "dirty" head.
I t doesnt look like beer, doesnt smell like beer, AND doesnt taste like beer.
Sweet, syrupy, not enough carbonation to counter it. A lemonade with some alcohol, pretending to be beer.
I will try a faro from another brewery, but Im fairly certain this is not my style of beer. I prefer the "real" lambics.

Bottle - Dark malts, spices and yeast.  Clear effervescent amber.  Sweet and mellow malts with some sourness with the spice of the rye.  You also get some rotting apple.  Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft pour at some place in Brussels. The appearance is deep amber with a creamy white head. The nose is prune, bread, refined sugar. Little else. The taste is crazy sweet. Loads of caramel and plum jelly. Lemonade. Just very sweet and syrupy. Medium body, slick on the tongue. Overall, never again. Bad, even by faro standards...

375ml bottle from Drinkswell, Ripon. Pours a clear brown-golden colour, thin bubbly white head that dissipates away and aroma of musty sour apple & brandy. Taste is sweet with wood, honey and also sour with apple & cherry notes. Smooth slightly syrupy mouth feel, well carbonated, crisp clean finish. Quite drinkable.

Brown, semi clear with thin head.
Sour aroma yeast and apples, also like something gone bad..
Fullbodied. Very carbonated and sour, overly sweet. 
Like applejuice past its best before date. Not to my liking.

Deep amber color with a medium white head that quickly dissipates.  Nice aroma of aged yeast, some mustiness.  Taste is sweet, much like a southern sweet tea it is too sweet and covers up any other flavors in the beer.  Not one of my favorites.

Pours a light darker red with orange hues producing a foamy head with light carbonation. Aromas of wood/oak, sour apple, honey, cork, and slight cherry. Flavors of sour/spicy apple, slight cherry, honey, oak/wood, and light cork. Medium to high sweetness, crisp, slightly sour,clean finish with almost no aftertaste. Wow my first faro lambic. I enjoy the sweetness here and like this style better than the other lambic styles. Taste like an aged lambic but with a dominant sweetness (the only real taste difference).

Bottled, 0.25l. Clear amber brown color with small lively bubbles and small tan-like head that disappeared immediately. Aroma of yeast, must, wine marc, berries, citrus, gluehwein and cinnamon. Taste starts with sweet malt and candy sugar, then followed by sour cherry and apple and lemon acidity. Its a bit too sweet, but still mild bitterness is present at finish. Medium body, sticky texture and lively natural carbonation in palate. Sweet & sour symphony...

Overly sweet, very syrupy no complexity. First ever Belgian drain pour after drinking Belgians for 12 years.
Bought from del haize bourse. Lovely art nouveau label. Shit beer.

Amber/brown colour with a finger of white head.
Fruity and sweet aroma with some champagne notes.
In mouth is sweet with a acid end. Not my style, to much sugar for me, but still good for drinking a glass.
bottle @ home. Gustosa, acisa e dolce contemporaneamente con schiuma cremosa e corpo soffice. Un pelo astringente sul finale ma ben bilanciato dalla dolcezza generale.

Head: beige foam. Colour: clear, amber. Aroma: fruit. Taste: bitter-sweet. Palate: mild, medium bitter finish. Overall: nice.

Bottle from Monoprix. Reddisg colour, large white head. The nose is very fruity, like a cider almost, sweet notes from the sugar. The taste is very ciderish, apples, but sweet not dry at all, you clearly feel the added sugar. Round finish. Personally Im not a fan of these sweet beers with added sugar so Ill skip this one the next time.

Head: off-white and humble. Color: dirty amber.

Aroma: sour and sweet, malty/grainy and horseblanket 

The taste i smostly the same but with less sweat. The sourness and sweetness are quite balanced to my taste.
Bottle pour in South Dakota.  Really like this faro - first of this style.  Sweet, cidery and a little bit of sour.  Sediment on the bottom

Doft av jäst. God smak. Balans i syrlighet och sötma. Spännande öltyp.

Mijn eerste Faro! Fles 37.5 cl, champagnefles-achtig, met zilverfolie, kroonkurk en kurk. Schuimt niet erg, schuim snel weg. Roodbruine kleur. Ruikt als geuze, zurig, rokerig.medium sweetness, lightly bitter, heavily sour, light body, average carbonation, long finish, smoke, brown, red, brown, cloudy, tan foam,

Pours clear light brown basically no head but very visible carbonation.  Big funk sour aroma, horse blanket and musty.  This is actually much sweeter than the aroma led me to anticipate.  Sour cherry sweetness, quite pleasant and really why I like this this style, although this is a bit too sweet to get top marks.
12 oz. bottle. Pours orangy brown with a small head. Aroma of dried fruit, yeast and cheese. Sweet at the first sip with a slightly sour finish.

Draft pour, amber color pour, medium sized white head. Aroma was sweet fruits, plenty of candi sugar notes. Flavor was very similar to the aroma, slightly apple tart sweet fruit notes, with plenty of almost grainy sweet sugar notes on the palate. An interesting brew, but too sweet for me, at least for around dinnertime.

250ml bottle bought at Belgian Beer Intl in Tsuen Wan; Clear deep ruby red colour; Almost no head and residual white foam which fades in 10 seconds; Minimal lacing with active carbonation; Pleasantly tart and somewhat woody aroma of brandy, light bourbon, sour fruit and slight hint of gin; champagne and white wine profile shows up as the beer warms; Strong but pleasant sweet taste of dry white wine, grape and fresh plum, light citrus and hint of grass. Medium to light body, dry and thin palate. Taste profile is dominated by dry and tart white wine and grape taste, with a bubbly champagne background throughout; Hoppiness is very subtle, rounding up with some juniper- like bitterness as finish. Very nice! Dry after taste, very easy, if somewhat musty, to mouth.

Comments: I am glad my first Faro is a good one and has already got me hooked! Its aroma, taste and palate is very complex, intriguing, pleasant, and typical to the style. That initial brandy - bourbon aroma is simply a touch of genius! Very comforting to have in Winter or cold evening. My only complaint is: 250 ml is not enough!  :)

Lambic aux couleurs caramel mou. Sa mousse généreuse est fuyante mais elle pétille joyeusement en bouche. Les arômes sont très proche du cidre, pomme, candi, épices. La bouche est bien sur sucrée et ronde mais une pointe d'acidité viens contrebalancer le tout. Enveloppante et légèrement piquante elle accompagnera aisément les desserts.

Flaska från beernavigator. Mörk för en lambic, troligen från candisockret, brunröd färg med jästinslag. Lambicdoft som känns snäll och söt. Sötsyrlig, men tyvärr mer söt än syrlig även om den blir allt torrare i munnen. Men första känslan är sötsliskig läsk, fruktig med drag av päron, körsbär och kvitten, träig beska på sluten. Som med många öl från Lindemans trevlig fruktighet men för stor sötma.
Nice beer. Pours a clear red brown with light white head and a lot of floaties. Aroma is sweet but a little musty. Taste is sweet and sour balanced. Syrupy sticky feel.

Pours a clear amber brew with a tiny white head with poor retenion, aroma is moderate acidic and low sweet with notes of Sour fruits, light bodied, flavor is moderate acidic and moderate sweet with notes of green apple, guava, cider, sweet and Sour  finish, unbalanced, unrefined.
Light ruby color with small white foam head. Aroma is quite fruity, sour fruits. Taste is sweet fruity, refreshing, interesting beer. Aftertaste is dry, bit sparkling. (Velp 201303)

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2013 12oz bottle. Pours clear copper with thin white head. Aroma is overwhelmingly sour, earthy, stinky, horseblanket. Taste is sweet but slightly sour. Definitely taste the sugar added to the lambic here. Nice balance and finish. Interesting beer. A nice finish. Aroma is stronger than taste here.

Interesting color, light reddish orange brown. Small bubbly head. Effervessant. Aroma is fruity, apple, wild earthy sour, sweet. Flavor is the same. Lighter body, sweet, middle woody, candy finish. Tickles... Tasty

a light, purpley/pink color.  good carbonation.  
Aroma-sour fruits
light fruity taste which ends very sour.  Though the sourness comes and goes throughout various sips, sometimes stronger than others.

375ml bottle. Amber with medium head. Nose : Sugar, cooked fruits, apple, tart. Sip : sweet tart with citrusy, pear and apple flavor. Its getting wood and sour and it lasts till the end together with the sweetness. Its a nice brew, very sweet and tasty. A bit to cloying but ok time to time.

SAQ import trade, showing 4.5% ABV. and with a cork, foil and a cap (what a waste of time to pop this one open). Golden-amber colour with lots of tiny particles floating around, creating some light haziness. Creamy-frothy off-white head with great retention and some sloppy lace. Aromas of apples, wood, mild coffee, cherries, roasted malt and light sourness. Nice sourness for taste, well-balanced with the sugar cane to sweeten things. Flavours of fruits (apples, rhubarb), caramel and hints of balsamic vinegar. A pretty nice, easy-drinking faro.

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Pours a clear reddish cooper with a nice white head. Aroma of fruits, yeast and malts. Taste is sweet at the beginning then turns a bit sour, and is of fruits malts and caramel (sugar). Very enjoyable, one of my favorite lambics so far.

Hazy, red-brown color with small head. Aroma is sour and sweet with some fruit esters (plum and blackberry). Not very intensive. Firslty, taste is very sour with "old" notes. High carbonation. Finish is the best side of this beer. Its long fruity. Generally, its my first lambic, but it wont be my favorite style of beer.

Pours clear copper with a diminishing, creamy white head. Aroma is toasty, with apple, caramel, cinnamon, fruit esters, and funky barnyard. Taste is initially sweet, quickly fading to sour apple sourness and a clean finish. Carbonation is fairly high, and the finish is fairly quick. Nice cidery sour beer with some subtleties.

Pours a dark copper color with a fizzy white head. Good barley, wheat & yeast aroma. Medium body with a tingly texture and soft carbonation. Moderate to heavy sweet fruity flavor with a solid fruit and small alcohol bite finish.  Much better than I anticipated.  Its almost like a beer made with gummy worms.
Dark orange color with nice off white head. Aroma of wine, cider, wet wood, basement aroma as well. Taste is well balanced sweet and sour. Light body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Nce lambic.

Aroma: apple, vinegar, candy?; Appearance: reddish amber, hazy, quickly disappearing pinkish foam; Taste: very sweet, little sour; Palate: rather medium body, thin/creamy feel, soft/moderate carbonation, quite long dry, wine-ish finish; Overall: quite gut bu not my glass of beer

Bronze colored with a dirty off-white head. Sweet malt, candy sugar and vomit (sourness) hit you like walking in on last nights frat party. Sweet malt and wood are the initial flavors with minimal sourness and no bitterness of note. A sweet and sour melange which works together rather well.

Very strange beer. Heavy, full bodied aroma of blue cheese and vinegar. Complex taste with sweet start and tart finish. A pleasure to try and a wonderful beer, but I think I would only like this in moderation.

Funky aroma - wild yeasty, little bit of candy, sour and interesting. Pours the colour of maple syrup, nice and clear and not very bubbly. This is a crazy flavour... Sour and sweet together. Tasting raspberries and Sweet Tart candies, with a backing of ... Something sour. Reminds me of those flavored vinegar drinks. This is a surprisingly nice beer. I like. Thanks to kevinsenn for sharing.

Pours amber with a thin white head. Aroma is....odd i honestly cant think of how to describe it, i think its mostly the candi sugar , smells sweet. Taste is very sweet, but not cloying, it starts tart at first but then thr sweet almost cola like flavor comes in
 Good brew, but hard to describe.

Bottle. Pours a dark amber beer with a small, off white head on top. Aroma is very sugary, sweet and malty. Has some tones of apple. Flavour returns the apple a lot, more like candied granny smith apples.. Quite sweet with a decent tartness backing up the sweetness. Very interesting, never had anything like this before.

The aroma is very sweet and funky with a subtle fruit quality. The appearance is copper gold with a thin head. The taste is like the aroma. The palate is thin. Overall drinkable but not my thing. Thanks to palidor for this final (and hard to buy) style I have now rated!

This a combination of funky, sweet and only slightly tart. A nice fruity and malt with just the right kick. Almost like a nice cider.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

average frothy white head. good lacing. mostly diminishing. aroma: dough, cherry and vinegar.  if: hevy sweet very light sour. ff: moderate sweet very light sour; average duration. palate: fizzy carbonation, watery texture, medium body, light astringent finish. hibrida entre limbic e fruit beer, com o dulçor da cereja sobrepujando quase todo o azedume e adstrigencia da primeira; recomendada para os que ainda não conhecem o estilo, ótima drinkability, carbonatação e dulçor lembram também espumantes leves ou lambrusco, 30 s
Brown color with ivory head. Sour and acetic aroma, goat barn. At taste is completely different, sweet by caramel sugar and medium bodied with lot of sweetness.

This Lindemans Lambic reminds me of a slightly fruity blue cheese.  I like blue cheese so this isnt a bad thing, necessarily but it is very strange to have beer remind me of blue cheese.  Im sure it would go well with some cheese and crackers.
